His legacy continues to be debated and analyzed, with some viewing him as a visionary leader who helped to reshape American politics and others criticizing his policies and rhetoric as divisive and harmful.

TEXT.English: [H1]Saguamanchica[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Ruler of the Muisca[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived:[\BOLD] Legendary[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Saguamanchica was a legendary ruler of the Muisca people, who lived in what is now Colombia during the pre-Columbian era. He is remembered as one of the most powerful and influential leaders of his time, and his legacy continues to inspire pride and admiration among the indigenous peoples of the region. According to legend, Saguamanchica was born in the late 15th century and rose to power as a result of his military prowess and strategic thinking. He is said to have been responsible for many important victories against rival tribes and kingdoms, and he is credited with consolidating the power of the Muisca people and establishing their dominance over much of the Andean region.[PARAGRAPH:2]Saguamanchica is also remembered for his contributions to Muisca culture and society. He is said to have introduced many important innovations in agriculture, architecture, and other areas of daily life, and he is credited with promoting the arts and sciences and encouraging the development of a complex system of writing and record-keeping. Today, Saguamanchica is remembered as one of the most important figures in Andean history, and his legacy continues to inspire pride and admiration among the indigenous peoples of the region. His name is also used to refer to a famous hotel and tourist attraction in the Colombian city of Zipaquira, which features an underground cathedral and other attractions that showcase the art, culture, and history of the Muisca people.

According to legend, Tacaynamo was born in the early 14th century and rose to power as a result of his bravery and military skill. He is said to have introduced many important innovations in agriculture, architecture, and other areas of daily life, and he is credited with promoting the arts and sciences and encouraging the development of a complex system of writing and record-keeping. Today, Tacaynamo remains an important figure in Andean mythology and folklore, and his legacy continues to inspire pride and admiration among the indigenous peoples of the region. His name is also used to refer to a famous tourist attraction in the Peruvian city of Tacna, which features a statue of Tacaynamo and other attractions that showcase the art, culture, and history of the Inca people.

He also advocated for conservation efforts and established many national parks and forests.[PARAGRAPH:2]Roosevelt was a larger-than-life figure who was known for his energetic personality and his love of adventure. TEXT.English: [H1]Toussaint L'Ouverture[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Governor of Saint-Domingue[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived:[\BOLD] 1743 - 1803 AD[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Toussaint L'Ouverture was a Haitian revolutionary leader who played a pivotal role in the Haitian Revolution, which led to the establishment of Haiti as the first independent nation in Latin America and the Caribbean. L'Ouverture was born into slavery in Saint-Domingue (now Haiti) in 1743. He was educated by the Jesuits and was fluent in French and Creole. In 1791, he became involved in the slave revolt that began in Saint-Domingue, which was then a French colony.[PARAGRAPH:2]L'Ouverture quickly rose to prominence as a military leader and strategist, and he led the rebels to many victories over the French forces. He also implemented a system of discipline and training that helped to strengthen the rebel army. In 1794, France abolished slavery in its colonies, and L'Ouverture joined forces with the French to drive out the British and Spanish forces that were attempting to conquer Saint-Domingue. L'Ouverture's leadership and military prowess helped to establish Saint-Domingue as a free and independent state.[PARAGRAPH:2]In 1801, L'Ouverture established a constitution for Saint-Domingue and became its governor. However, he was soon betrayed by the French and was arrested and sent to France, where he died in prison in 1803. L'Ouverture is remembered as a hero in Haitian history and a symbol of the struggle for freedom and independence. His leadership and military skills were instrumental in the Haitian Revolution, which inspired other independence movements in Latin America and the Caribbean. He is also revered as a symbol of Haitian identity and pride.

[TAB]An academy is a school for advanced learning. Though China, Egypt, and India had such institutes earlier, the term "academy" was first applied to the Athenian school of philosophy, founded by Plato in approximately 390 BC. The school was built near a sacred grove named "Hekademia."[PARAGRAPH:1]An academy was an important asset for a city. It attracted both brilliant scholars and the children of wealthy or noble parents, who might then decide to settle in the city permanently. The academy could provide a broad, general education to its students, or it might concentrate upon a specific subject such as philosophy, mathematics, art, natural philosophy (the world and everything in it), or the martial arts.[PARAGRAPH:1]Today there are many educational facilities which bear the name "academy." The term is used loosely now, and in addition to its original meaning, is often applied to schools for children and teenagers.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Une académie est une école d'enseignement supérieur. Si la Chine, l'Egypte et l'Inde connaissaient déjà ce type d'instituts, le terme "académie" est appliqué pour la première fois à l'école de philosophie d'Athènes, fondée par Platon vers 390 av. J.-C. Cette école était construite dans un jardin nommé "Académie".[PARAGRAPH:1]Une académie constitue un atout important pour une ville. Elle attire de brillants érudits et les enfants de nobles ou de riches familles qui peuvent ensuite décider de s'installer définitivement dans la ville. L'académie peut offrir un enseignement général très vaste à ses étudiants ou se concentrer sur une matière spécifique telle que la philosophie, les mathématiques, l'art, la philosophie naturelle (le monde et tout ce qu'il comporte) ou les arts martiaux.[PARAGRAPH:1]Aujourd'hui, de nombreuses structures d'enseignement portent le nom d'"académie". Le terme est désormais utilisé assez librement et son sens originel a été élargi, s'appliquant souvent aux écoles pour enfants et adolescents.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Eine Akademie ist eine Schule der höheren Wissenschaften. Obwohl es in China, Ägypten und Indien bereits früher vergleichbare Einrichtungen gab, stammt der Begriff "Akademie" von der 390 vor Christus von Platon gegründeten Philosophenschule in Athen. Diese befand sich in der Nähe eines heiligen Hains mit dem Namen "Hekademia".[PARAGRAPH:1] Eine Akademie war eine wichtige Errungenschaft für eine Stadt. Sie lockte brilliante Gelehrte und die Kinder der Reichen und Adligen an, die sich vielleicht dauerhaft in der Stadt niederließen. Die Akademie bot ihren Schülern eine breite Allgemeinbildung oder spezialisierte sich auf ein bestimmtes Fach, wie Philosophie, Mathematik, Kunst, Naturkunde (die Welt und was sich darin befindet) oder Kampfkunst.[PARAGRAPH:1]Heute tragen viele Lehranstalten den Namen "Akademie". Der Begriff wird weitläufig verwendet und bezeichnet oft Schulen für Kinder und Teenager.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Un'accademia è una scuola per l'apprendimento avanzato. Malgrado Cina, Egitto e India avessero fondato questi istituti molto tempo prima, il termine "accademia" fu coniato per la prima volta nella scuola Ateniese di filosofia istituita da Platone verso il 390 a. C. La scuola venne costruita presso un luogo sacro di nome "Hekademia."[PARAGRAPH:1]L'accademia rappresentava un luogo importante per la città poiché attirava studiosi brillanti con le proprie famiglie benestanti e nobili, che potevano decidere di trasferirsi definitivamente. L'accademia forniva un'educazione generale ai propri studenti e si concentrava sull'approfondimento di materie come la filosofia, la matematica, l'arte, la percezione del mondo e della natura o le arti marziali.[PARAGRAPH:1]Al giorno d'oggi esistono molti edifici dedicati all'istruzione che si fregiano del nome "accademia": questo termine viene oramai utilizzato in modo inappropriato e viene spesso citato a proposito degli istituti di istruzione per bambini e ragazzi.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Una academia es una escuela en la que se imparten conocimientos avanzados. Aunque este tipo de institución apareció primero en China, Egipto y la India, el término "academia" se aplicó por primera vez a la escuela de filosofía de Atenas, fundada por Platón en el año 390 d. C. La escuela se levantaba cerca de una sagrada arboleda llamada "Hekademia."[PARAGRAPH:1]La academia era un importante activo en una ciudad. Atraía a brillantes eruditos y a los hijos de los ricos o los aristócratas, quienes podían tomar la decisión de instalarse en la ciudad de forma permanente. Podía proporcionar una educación amplia y general a sus estudiantes, o podía concentrarse en materias más específicas, como la filosofía, las matemáticas, el arte, la filosofía natural (el mundo y todo cuanto contiene) o las artes materiales.[PARAGRAPH:1]Hoy en día existen muchas instituciones educativas que llevan el nombre de "academia". El término se emplea con libertad en nuestros días, y además de su acepción original, suele aplicarse a las escuelas para niños y adolescentes.

TEXT.English: [TAB]An administrative center is a seat of regional administration or local government, or a county town, or the place where the central administration of a commune is located. Local Government is a form of public administration which in a majority of contexts, exists as the lowest tier of administration within a given state. The term is used to contrast with offices at state level, which are referred to as the central government, national government, or (where appropriate) federal government and also to supranational government which deals with governing institutions between states. Local governments generally act within powers delegated to them by legislation or directives of the higher level of government. In federal states, local government generally comprises the third (or sometimes fourth) tier of government, whereas in unitary states, local government usually occupies the second or third tier of government, often with greater powers than higher-level administrative divisions.[PARAGRAPH:1]The question of municipal autonomy is a key question of public administration and governance. The institutions of local government vary greatly between countries, and even where similar arrangements exist, the terminology often varies. Common names for local government entities include state, province, region, department, county, prefecture, district, city, township, town, borough, parish, municipality, shire, village, and local service district.

[TAB]During the 20th Century, the advent of the automobile has created an urban and suburban landscape in which people live in one area but can shop, play and work elsewhere - often miles away from their homes. Nowhere is this more true than in the United States of America, whose citizens are noted for an almost fanatical devotion to their cars. This has had important social, environmental and economic affects upon life in America, leading to (among other things) the creation of that most American of institution - the shopping mall.[PARAGRAPH:1]American shopping malls are surrounded by acres and acres of parking lots, and they may contain dozens (if not hundreds) of stores selling everything from clothing to jewelry to electronics to books to computers to videos. In some ways American shopping malls are akin in spirit to the old Arabian markets (although Americans don't particularly enjoy haggling and prices are generally fixed).[PARAGRAPH:1]The earliest automobile-centered shopping center was the "Market Square," opened in Chicago, Illinois, in 1916. Constructed in Minnesota in 1992, the "Mall of America" is the largest mall in the world. It contains over 500 shops, 80 restaurants, a theme park, hotel, and movie theatres. It is housed in a building large enough to hold over 30 Boeing 747 airplanes.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le XXe siècle voit l'avènement de l'automobile et l'apparition d'un nouveau paysage urbain et rural. Les individus vivent à un endroit, mais font leurs courses, se divertissent et travaillent ailleurs, souvent à des kilomètres de chez eux. Il n'y a pas de meilleur exemple que les Etats-Unis d'Amérique quand on parle de dévouement fanatique pour sa voiture. Les répercussions sociales, environnementales et économiques sur la vie des Américains sont évidentes. En effet, on a pu assisté (parmi d'autres choses) à la création de la plus américaine des institutions : le centre commercial.[PARAGRAPH:1]Les centres commerciaux américains sont entourés de parkings s'étendant sur des kilomètres et se composent de dizaines (voire de centaines) de magasins vendant toutes sortes de choses : vêtements, bijoux, matériel électronique, livres, ordinateurs, télévisions... Par certains côtés, les centres commerciaux américains ressemblent aux anciens souks arabes (même si les Américains n'aiment pas particulièrement marchandés et que les prix sont généralement fixes).[PARAGRAPH:1]Le tout premier centre commercial dédié à l'automobile fut le "Market Square", ouvert à Chicago dans l'Illinois en 1916. Le "Mall of America", construit dans le Minnesota en 1992, est le plus grand centre commercial du monde. On y trouve plus de 500 magasins, 80 restaurants, un parc d'attraction, des hôtels et des cinémas. Ce bâtiment pourrait accueillir plus de 30 avions Boeing 747.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Im 20. Jahrhundert entwickelte sich durch die Verfügbarkeit von Automobilen eine in städtische und vorstädtische Regionen unterteilte urbane Landschaft, die es ermöglichte, dass die Menschen in einem Stadtteil wohnten und in einem anderen Stadtteil einkauften, Freizeitaktivitäten nachgingen und natürlich auch arbeiteten - oft mehrere Kilometer von ihrem Zuhause entfernt. Nirgendwo fand diese Struktur mehr Anwendung als in den Vereinigten Staaten von Amerika, deren Bevölkerung dafür bekannt ist, eine fast schon fanatische Vorliebe für ihre Autos zu haben. Eine solche städtische Ordnung hatte tief greifende soziale, umweltpolitische und wirtschaftliche Auswirkungen auf den amerikanischen Lebensstil, die unter anderem zur Entstehung einer typisch amerikanischen Erscheinung führte: dem Einkaufszentrum.[PARAGRAPH:1]Die amerikanischen Einkaufszentren bieten gigantische Parkplatzflächen und können Dutzende (wenn nicht gar Hunderte) von Einzelgeschäften umfassen, die von Kleidung und Schmuck über Elektrogeräte bis hin zu Büchern, Computern und Videos nahezu alles verkaufen. In gewisser Hinsicht ähneln sie den alten arabischen Basaren (wenngleich die Amerikaner nicht unbedingt gerne feilschen und die Preise daher in der Regel von vornherein festgelegt sind).[PARAGRAPH:1]Das erste mit dem Auto erreichbare Einkaufszentrum dieser Art war das "Market Square", welches 1916 in Chicago, Illinois, seine Pforten öffnete. 1992 wurde in Minnesota mit der "Mall of America" das größte Einkaufszentrum der Welt eröffnet. Es enthält mehr als 500 Ladenlokale, 80 Restaurants, einen Vergnügungspark, ein Hotel und mehrere Kinosäle. Die Gesamtfläche des Gebäudekomplexes würde genug Platz für die Unterbringung von mehr als 30 Flugzeugen des Typs Boeing 747 bieten.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]L'avvento dell'automobile nel XX secolo ha determinato un paesaggio urbano e suburbano tali per cui le persone possono vivere in una zona e lavorare, divertirsi e fare affari altrove, spesso a diversi chilometri da casa. In nessun luogo ciò è maggiormente vero che negli Stati Uniti d'America, i cui cittadini sono noti per la loro devozione quasi fanatica alle auto, che non ha mancato di avere importanti ripercussioni sociali, ambientali ed economiche in America, portando peraltro alla nascita di quella istituzione tutta americana che è il centro commerciale.[PARAGRAPH:1]I centri commerciali americani sono circondati da ettari ed ettari di parcheggio e possono contenere decine (se non centinaia) di negozi, da quelli di abbigliamento ai gioiellieri, da quelli di elettronica alle librerie e così via. In un certo senso i centri commerciali americani sono molto vicini ai bazar arabi (anche se agli Americani non piace trattare e i prezzi sono di solito fissi).[PARAGRAPH:1]Il primo centro commerciale con ampio parcheggio fu il "Market Square", aperto a Chicago (Illinois) nel 1916. Costruito nel Minnesota nel 1992, il "Mall of America" è il più grande centro commerciale del mondo: contiene oltre 500 negozi, 80 ristoranti, un parco dei divertimenti, un hotel e persino dei cinema. L'edificio del centro commerciale è talmente vasto da poter ospitare oltre trenta Boeing 747.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]En el s. XX, la aparición del automóvil creó un paisaje en la ciudad y la periferia en el que la gente vivía en una zona pero podía comprar, jugar y trabajar en otra, con frecuencia a kilómetros de distancia de su hogar. En ningún lugar es esto más cierto que en los Estados Unidos de América, cuyos ciudadanos son famosos por su fanática devoción por sus coches. Esto tuvo importantes efectos sociales y económicos en la vida estadounidense, pues llevó (entre otras cosas) a la aparición de lo que sería una de las instituciones del país: el centro comercial.[PARAGRAPH:1]Los centros comerciales estadounidenses están rodeados de hectáreas y hectáreas de aparcamientos y contienen decenas (cuando no centenares) de tiendas en las que se vende de todo, desde joyas a electrodomésticos, pasando por libros, ordenadores y vídeos. En cierto sentido, los centros comerciales estadounidenses recuerdan el espíritu de los antiguos bazares árabes (aunque a los norteamericanos no es que les guste especialmente regatear y los precios suelen ser fijos).[PARAGRAPH:1]El primer centro comercial pensado para coches fue el Market Square, que se abrió en Chicago, Illinois, en 1916. El centro comercial Mall of America, construido en Minnesota en 1992, es el más grande del mundo. Contiene 500 tiendas, 80 restaurantes, un parque temático, un hotel y salas de cine. Se encuentra en un edificio tan grande que cabrían dentro 30 aviones Boeing 747.

TEXT.English: [TAB]An installation intended for the cooling, freezing, and cold storage of perishable food products and other perishables. It operates as an independent enterprise, comprises a cold-storage warehouse with truck and railroad platforms, compressor and condenser rooms for a refrigerating system, a cooling tower, reservoirs and a pumping station for a circulating water supply, administration and residential buildings, and other buildings and installations.[PARAGRAPH:1]Port cold-storage facilities are used for the short-term storage of freight when freight is transferred from one type of transport to another, for example, from water to railroad transport, and are usually built in river ports or seaports. Central cold-storage facilities are intended for the long-term storage of products drawn from processing-and-procurement cold-storage facilities for the purpose of creating reserves. Commercial cold-storage facilities, such as refrigerated cabinets and sectional coolers, are used for the short-term storage of products at trading depots and in, for example, stores, dining rooms, and restaurants. In addition to general-purpose cold-storage facilities, which are intended for the storage of a wide variety of products, specialized cold-storage facilities are built for the storage of such products as fruits, vegetables, eggs, and salted fish.

[TAB]Warfare has been a recurring phenomenon throughout the history of mankind, and it continues to plague the world today. Although war is not a desirable situation, it is important that even the most peaceful of societies be prepared for the possibility of war. When warring nations are closely matched in technology and manpower, the army with the best training usually wins battles. Military schools and academies exist all over the world, established for the purpose of training military personnel in the latest methods, tactics, and technology. Men and women who graduate from such facilities possess higher than average command and military and technological skills, making them more effective in combat situations.
TEXT.French: [TAB]La guerre est un phénomène récurrent dans l'histoire de l'humanité et elle continue à affecter le monde aujourd'hui encore. Si la guerre n'est pas souhaitable, il est important que même les sociétés les plus pacifistes soient préparées à son éventualité. Lorsque des nations en guerre ont à peu près la même puissance technologique et le même nombre d'hommes, l'armée la plus entraînée est généralement victorieuse. Des écoles et académies militaires existent dans le monde entier ; elles ont été créées afin d'assurer l'entraînement du personnel militaire aux méthodes, tactiques et technologies les plus récentes. Les hommes et femmes diplômés de ces établissements disposent généralement de capacités de commandement et de compétences militaires et technologiques supérieures à la moyenne, les rendant plus efficaces au combat.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Kriegerische Auseinandersetzungen hat es im Verlauf der menschlichen Geschichte bis zur Gegenwart gegeben. Wenngleich sich niemand einen Krieg wünscht, ist es dennoch wichtig, dass selbst die friedfertigsten Völker auf einen möglichen Kriegsausbruch vorbereitet sind. Wenn zwei Krieg führende Nationen über das gleiche technologische und militärische Potenzial verfügen, so ist für den Ausgang einzelner Gefechte in der Regel ausschlaggebend, wer die besser ausgebildeten Streitkräfte aufzuweisen hat. Militärschulen und -akademien, die militärisches Personal in den modernsten Militärtaktiken und -technologien unterweisen, existieren in allen Ländern der Welt. Die Absolventen besitzen nicht nur überdurchschnittliches Fachwissen, sondern verfügen auch über weit reichende militärische und technologische Fertigkeiten, die ihnen in Gefechtssituationen zugute kommen.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Le guerre sono un fenomeno che ha interessato e continua a interessare la storia dell'uomo; è quindi importante che anche le società più pacifiche siano preparate a questo evento. Nel caso in cui due nazioni nemiche si trovino ad avere un livello tecnologico simile, è la preparazione dei soldati a fare la differenza. Le scuole e le accademie militari sono diffuse in tutto il mondo e hanno lo scopo di preparare le reclute agli equipaggiamenti e alle tecniche più avanzate. Coloro che si diplomano in questi luoghi possiedono abilità militari e cognizioni tattiche di alto livello, che li rendono più efficaci in situazioni di combattimento.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]La guerra ha sido un fenómeno recurrente a lo largo de la historia de la humanidad y sigue atormentándola en la actualidad. Aunque no es una situación deseable, es importante que hasta las más pacíficas sociedades estén preparadas para la posibilidad de que se produzca un conflicto así. Cuando las naciones en guerra se encuentran igualadas en tecnología y mano de obra, el ejército mejor entrenado es el que suele ganar las batallas. Las escuelas y academias militares existen en todos los lugares del mundo, creadas con el propósito de entrenar al personal en los métodos, tácticas y tecnologías más modernos. Los hombres y mujeres que se gradúan en estas instituciones poseen habilidades de mando, tecnológicas y militares por encima de lo normal, lo que les proporciona mayor efectividad en combate.

TEXT.English: [TAB]A bomb shelter is a structure designed to protect the people inside from falling bombs. Today's bomb shelters are designed to shield one from the destruction of a nuclear attack. People have constructed bomb shelters since the first artillery piece was put into action. Sometimes these are rude caves dug in a hillside; sometimes they are elaborate and complicated affairs, self-sustaining for weeks, dug hundreds of feet below the surface.[PARAGRAPH:1]In the 1950s during the Cold War, American citizens began constructing bomb shelters in their back yards and basements, hoping to avoid destruction during the atomic war they were sure was coming. The US government embarked on an ambitious program to create large bomb shelters in all major cities, stocking them with food, water, blankets, and other essential supplies. These are mostly abandoned today, probably because of the realization that most of them are not strong enough to do much good in the event of a nuclear attack.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Un abri antiaérien est une structure permettant à la population de s'y réfugier pour se protéger des attaques par bombes. Les abris antiaériens actuels sont conçus pour résister à une attaque nucléaire. Depuis l'introduction des premières pièces d'artillerie, les populations ont construit des abris antiaériens. Parfois, il s'agit de simples grottes creusées à flanc de coteau mais ces abris peuvent aussi être des constructions élaborées et complexes, permettant de subsister pendant des semaines et construites à plusieurs mètres sous terre.[PARAGRAPH:1]Dans les années 1950, pendant la guerre froide, les citoyens américains ont commencé à construire des abris dans les jardins et dans les caves, espérant ainsi échapper à la destruction lors de la guerre nucléaire qu'ils étaient sûrs de voir se déclencher. Le gouvernement américain s'est alors engagé dans un ambitieux programme de création de grands abris dans toutes les grandes villes, les approvisionnant en nourriture, eau, couvertures et autres réserves indispensables. La plupart d'entre eux sont désormais abandonnés, sans doute parce qu'ils ne seraient pas suffisamment efficaces dans le cas d'une attaque nucléaire.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Luftschutzkeller schützen die darin versammelten Menschen vor Bombenangriffen. Moderne Luftschutzkeller wurden entwickelt, um Menschen im Fall eines Atomangriffs zu schützen. Die ersten Luftschutzkeller entstanden mit dem ersten Einsatz von Artillerie. Manchmal handelt es sich nur um in Hügel gegrabene Höhlen; manche sind ausgefeilte komplexe Anlagen hunderte Meter unter der Oberfläche, die wochenlang autark sein können.[PARAGRAPH:1]In den 50er Jahren des 20. Jahrhunderts entstanden in unzähligen amerikanischen Gärten und Kellern Luftschutzkeller, als die Menschen versuchten, sich vor den Folgen eines möglichen Atomschlags zu schützen. Die amerikanische Regierung ließ damals in allen Großstädten Luftschutzkeller bauen und diese mit Lebensmitteln, Wasser, Decken und lebensnotwendigen Vorräten ausstatten. Heute sind die meisten Luftschutzkeller verlassen, da sie einem Atomangriff nicht standhalten würden.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Un rifugio antiaereo è una struttura pensata per proteggere le persone all'interno dai bombardamenti. I rifugi odierni sono stati realizzati in maniera tale da sopravvivere in caso di attacco nucleare. Le popolazioni hanno cominciato a costruire rifugi dai tempi della prima unità di artiglieria: molto spesso si trattava di caverne scavate sul lato di una collina, in altri casi invece si trattava di strutture più complesse, con autonomia di settimane, posizionate a centinaia di metri nel sottosuolo.[PARAGRAPH:1]Negli anni '50, durante la Guerra Fredda, i cittadini Americani cominciarono a costruire dei rifugi nei propri cortili e nelle cantine, nella speranza di evitare la distruzione durante l'imminente, presunta, guerra nucleare. Il governo degli USA avviò un programma ambizioso per la realizzazione di grandi rifugi nel cuore delle grandi città, forniti di cibo, acqua, coperte e altre scorte fondamentali. Al giorno d'oggi, la maggior parte di questi rifugi è abbandonata, probabilmente perché vennero costruiti in modo tale da non poter reggere un eventuale attacco nucleare.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Un refugio antiaéreo es una estructura diseñada para proteger a la gente de las bombas. En la actualidad pueden proteger incluso de una detonación nuclear. La gente ha construido refugios desde que aparecieron los primeros cañones. A veces son toscas cuevas excavadas en la ladera de una colina; otras, son complejos elaborados y sofisticados, capaces de sustentar a sus moradores durante semanas, a cientos de metros de la superficie.[PARAGRAPH:1]En la década de los 50, durante la Guerra Fría, la ciudadanía americana empezó a construir refugios en sus jardines y sótanos, para escapar a la destrucción de la guerra nuclear que, desde su punto de vista, era inevitable. El gobierno norteamericano se embarcó en un ambicioso programa destinado a crear grandes refugios en todas las ciudades importantes, donde se almacenó comida, agua, mantas y otros artículos esenciales. En la actualidad, la gran mayoría han sido abandonados, probablemente porque ha quedado constatado que no son lo bastante sólidos como para sobrevivir a un ataque nuclear.

TEXT.English: [TAB]In the mid-19th century, Brazil had been undergoing an economic transformation brought about by a new export crop: coffee. Coffee provided a new basis for agricultural expansion in southern Brazil. In the provinces of Rio de Janeiro and then São Paulo, coffee estates, or fazendas, began to spread toward the interior as new lands were opened. By 1850, coffee made up more than 50% of Brazil's exports, and more than half of world coffee production.[PARAGRAPH:1]Along with the expansion of coffee growing came an intensification of slavery in Brazil, as the country's primary form of labor. More than 1.4 million Africans were forced to be slaves in Brazil in the last 50 years of the slave trade, and even after the trans-Atlantic slave trade ended, slavery continued until 1888.[PARAGRAPH:1]Because of the increased profit from the trade of coffee, the years after 1850 saw considerable growth and prosperity in Brazil. Dom Pedro II proved to be an enlightened man of middle-class habits who was anxious to reign over a tranquil and progressive nation, even if that tranquility was based on slave labor. Railroads, steamships and the telegraph were introduced to Brazil, all paid for by the money the fazendas supplied from their coffee crop. In growing cities such as Rio de Janeiro and São Paulo, merchants, lawyers, a middle class, and an urban working class grew, once again paid for by the money coming from the fazendas.

[TAB]A chaitya is a Buddhist shrine or prayer hall with a stupa at one end. Chaityas were constructed to hold large numbers of devotees and to provide shelter for them. Early chaityas were built as standing structures with the stupa being surrounded by a colonnaded processional path enclosed by an outer wall with a congregation hall adjoining it. The more spectacular and more numerous chaityas, however, were cut into living rock as caves.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Eine Chaitya ist ein buddhistischer Schrein oder eine Gebetshalle, an deren Ende sich eine Stupa befindet. Fr�he Chaityas wurden als stehende Bauwerke errichtet, in denen die Stupa von s�ulenumgebenen Prozessionspfad innerhalb der �u�eren Mauer umgeben ist, und an die eine Versammlungshalle anschlie�t. Die spektakul�reren und zahlreicheren Chaityas wurden allerdings als H�hlen in lebendigen Fels gehauen.

TEXT.English: [TAB]A monastery is a building where monks can retreat from the world and concentrate upon the divine. Usually a monastery will have strict rules of conduct to protect its unworldly members from temptation. In some monasteries, the monks are totally silent; in others no visitors are allowed inside. Monasteries usually have many daily rituals and religious services.[PARAGRAPH:1]Throughout the ages monasteries have often been centers of learning. In remote areas the monks may be the only literate people for miles around. Monks have often been employed as scribes, copying out the words of their religion's sacred scripture. Monasteries frequently have extensive libraries, holding religious, scientific, medical and philosophical texts.[PARAGRAPH:1]Sanghas, alternately also called Viharas, were originally created to provide places for the wandering Buddhist monks to make their annual retreats. Some Buddhist monks stay indoors during the three-month rainy season to avoid damaging new plant growth (and to avoid being stranded during inclement weather). In the past, wealthy supporters donated plots of land where the monks could retreat; over time these have evolved into monasteries, often large and wealthy structures where monks can live year round.

[TAB]Located near Patna, in Bihar state, India, the Mahabodhi is a Buddhist temple in Bodh Gaya, the place where, according to Buddhist tradition, Siddhartha Gautama gained enlightenment and became the Buddha while meditating under a Bodhi (Peepal) tree.[PARAGRAPH:1]The Emperor Asoka constructed the "Golden Throne" sometime around 250 BC, and over time many other buildings and statues were added. In the 12th century the area was overrun by Muslims, and the temple sacked and largely destroyed. In the 16th century a Hindu monastery was established, and the monastery's abbot was given control over the temple grounds.[PARAGRAPH:1]Eventually the area came under British control. In the 1880s they began a major restoration of the temple, much against the wishes of the Hindu abbot. In the 1940s control over the site was given to the state, which manages the site with the advice of a committee containing Buddhists from the world over.[PARAGRAPH:1]A building of remarkable beauty and grandeur, the Mahabodhi is one of the oldest surviving brick buildings in India. Standing on the ruins of an even older "stupa," the temple consists of a high central tower surrounded by four smaller towers. The central tower rises some 60 feet in height. The edifice is covered by ornate and colorful molding, pilasters (pseudo columns), and arches, many of which contain bas relief sculptures. Inside sits a very large gilded statue of the Buddha. The statue sits where, legend has it, the Buddha was sitting when he achieved enlightenment.[PARAGRAPH:1]Near to the building stands a mighty Bodhi tree, a descendant of the one under which Buddha found enlightenment. The temple stands within an extensive complex of smaller temples, statues, and pathways running through beautiful parklands and alongside peaceful lakes. The temple and its surroundings remain a focus of Buddhist worship, and people from across the world come every year to honor the Buddha and to marvel at the beauty of the Mahabodhi.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Situé près de Patna dans l'état du Bihar en Inde, le temple de la Mahabodhi est un temple bouddhiste du site de Bodh Gaya où, selon la tradition bouddhiste, Siddhartha Gautama est parvenu à l'éveil et est devenu le Bouddha après avoir médité sous un arbre de la Bodhi ou Pipal (Ficus religiosa).[PARAGRAPH:1]L'empereur Ashoka construit le "trône de diamant" vers 250 av. J.-C. et au fil du temps, beaucoup d'autres édifices et statues sont ajoutés. Au XIIe siècle, la région est envahie par les musulmans et les temples sont saccagés et, en grande partie, détruits. Au XVIe siècle, un monastère hindou est fondé et le mahant, son dirigeant, est chargé de contrôler les terrains abritant le temple.[PARAGRAPH:1]La région passe ensuite sous contrôle britannique et dans les années 1880, les Britanniques commencent une grande restauration du temple à l'encontre du mahant hindou. Dans les années 1940, la protection du site est confiée à l'Etat qui le gère avec les conseils d'un comité composé de bouddhistes du monde entier.[PARAGRAPH:1]Le Mahabodhi, à la beauté remarquable et au caractère grandiose, est l'un des plus vieux bâtiments de brique en Inde. S'élevant au milieu des ruines d'un "stupa" encore plus vieux, le temple consiste en une haute tour centrale de 18 m entourée de quatre tours plus petites. L'édifice est recouvert de moulures ornées et colorées, de pilastres (une sorte de colonnes) et d'arches dont beaucoup présentent des sculptures en bas-relief. A l'intérieur se trouve une très grande statue dorée du Bouddha. Selon la légende, elle se situe exactement à l'endroit où il était assis lorsqu'il a connu l'éveil.[PARAGRAPH:1]A côté de l'édifice est planté un imposant arbre de la Bodhi qui est une bouture de celui sous lequel le Bouddha se trouvait lorsqu'il a connu l'éveil. Le temple se situe au milieu d'un vaste ensemble de temples plus petits, de statues et de chemins traversant de magnifiques parcs boisés et longeant de paisibles lacs. Le temple et ses environs restent un haut lieu du bouddhisme et des personnes du monde entier y viennent chaque année pour honorer le Bouddha et être émerveillées par la beauté du Mahabodhi.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Der Mahabodhi, ein buddhistischer Tempel in Bodh Gaya, steht in der Nähe von Patna im indischen Bihar, an jenem Ort, an dem Siddhartha Gautama die Erleuchtung fand und zu Buddha wurde, als er unter einem Bodhi (Feigenbaum) meditierte.[PARAGRAPH:1]Kaiser Ashoka baute den "Goldenen Thron" etwa um 250 vor Christus. Im Laufe der Zeit wurden viele weitere Gebäude und Statuen hinzugefügt. Im 12. Jahrhundert eroberten Muslime das Gebiet, die den Tempel plünderten und weitgehend zerstörten. Im 16. Jahrhundert wurde ein Hindukloster gegründet. Der Abt des Klosters kontrollierte auch das Tempelgelände.[PARAGRAPH:1]Schließlich wurde das Gebiet den Briten unterstellt. In den 80er Jahren des 19. Jahrhunderts begann man, den Tempel (gegen den Willen des Hinduabtes) zu restaurieren. In den 40er Jahren des 20. Jahrhunderts fiel das Gelände an den Staat, der es nun mithilfe eines buddhistischen Komitees verwaltet.[PARAGRAPH:1]Der Mahabodhi ist ein erhabenes Gebäude und eine der ältesten erhaltenen Ziegelbauten Indiens. Der Tempel steht auf den Ruinen einer noch älteren "Stupa". Er besteht aus einem hohen zentralen Turm, der von vier kleineren Türmen umringt ist. Der zentrale Turm ist etwa 18 Meter hoch. Das Gebäude ist mit zahlreichen farbenfrohen Verzierungen geschmückt. Darüber hinaus gibt es zahlreiche Pilaster (Wandsäulen) und Bögen mit kunstvollen Reliefskulpturen. Im Gebäude selbst thront eine goldene Buddhastatue an dem Ort, an dem Buddha angeblich zum Zeitpunkt seiner Erleuchtung saß.[PARAGRAPH:1]Unweit des Gebäudes steht ein großer Feigenbaum, ein Spross jenes Baumes, unter dem Buddha die Erleuchtung fand. Der Tempel steht im Zentrum einer größeren Tempelanlage mit einer prächtigen Parklandschaft und einem See. Der Tempel ist bis heute ein Zentrum des Buddhismus. Menschen aus aller Welt reisen Jahr für Jahr hierher, um Buddha zu ehren und die Schönheit des Mahabodhi zu bewundern.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Situato vicino a Patna, nello stato di Bihar in India, il Mahabodhi è un tempio Buddista che si trova a Bodh Gaya, il posto nel quale, secondo la tradizione, Siddhartha Gautama raggiunse l'illuminazione e divenne Buddha mentre meditava sotto un albero Bodhi.[PARAGRAPH:1]L'Imperatore Ashoka costruì il "tempio d'oro" verso il 250 a. C. e con il passare del tempo vennero aggiunti altri edifici e palazzi, finché nel XII secolo la zona non venne conquistata dai Musulmani con il tempio saccheggiato e in parte bruciato. Nel XVI secolo, venne fondato un monastero Indù e divenne compito dell'abate controllare il territorio del tempio.[PARAGRAPH:1]Successivamente, la zona passò sotto il controllo Britannico e nel 1880 vennero avviati dei lavori di ristrutturazione, la maggior parte dei quali contro la volontà dell'abate Indù. Nel 1940, il controllo del luogo venne affidato allo stato con la consulenza di di un comitato Buddista.[PARAGRAPH:1]Il Mahabodhi è uno degli edifici di mattoni più antichi dell'India: situato sulle rovine di uno "stupa" precedente, il tempio è formato da una grande torre circondata da altre quattro più piccole. La torre centrale misura quasi una ventina di metri e l'intero complesso architettonico è riccamente ornato, decorato con molti colori, pilastri e archi, molti dei quali ospitano sculture in bassorilievo. All'interno si trova una statua gigantesca del Budda posizionata nel punto che rappresenta l'attimo nel quale ricevette l'illuminazione.[PARAGRAPH:1]Vicino all'edificio si trova un maestoso albero Bodhi, discendente di quello sotto al quale Budda trovò l'illuminazione. Il tempio si trova nel mezzo di un complesso architettonico formato da templi più piccoli, statue e sentieri che attraversano parchi meravigliosi costeggiando placidi specchi d'acqua. Il tempio e i suoi dintorni rimangono il fulcro del Buddismo: ogni anno, fedeli da tutto il mondo accorrono per onorare Budda e osservare la magnificenza del Mahabodhi.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Situado cerca de Patna, en el estado de Bihar, la India, el Mahabodhi es un templo budista enclavado en Bodh Gaya, lugar donde, según la tradición budista, Siddhartha Gautama fue iluminado y se convirtió en el Buda mientras meditaba bajo un árbol bodhi (Peepal).[PARAGRAPH:1]El emperador Ashoka construyó el "trono dorado" en torno al año 250 a. C., y con el tiempo se le fueron añadiendo muchos otros edificios y estatuas. En el siglo XII, el área fue conquistada por los musulmanes y el templo fue saqueado y casi destruido. En el siglo XVI se fundó un monasterio hindú, a cuyo abad se otorgó el control de las tierras del templo.[PARAGRAPH:1]Más tarde, la zona acabó bajo control británico. En la década de 1880, los británicos iniciaron una restauración general del templo, en contra de los deseos expresos del abad hindú. En la década de los 40 se entregó el lugar al estado, que lo administra con el consejo de un comité formado por budistas de todo el mundo.[PARAGRAPH:1]Un edificio de belleza y grandeza notables, el Mahabodhi es una de las construcciones de ladrillo más antiguas de la India. Construido sobre las ruinas de un "stupa" aún más antiguo, este templo está formado por una gran torre central rodeada por cuatro más pequeñas. La torre central mide casi veinte pies de altura. El edificio está cubierto de bonitas y coloridas pilastras (falsas columnas) y arcos, muchos de los cuales contienen bajorrelieves. En su interior hay una gran estatua dorada de Buda. La estatua se encuentra en el mismo sitio donde, según la leyenda, estaba Buda cuando fue iluminado.[PARAGRAPH:1]Cerca del edificio hay un poderosos árbol de bodhi descendiente de aquél bajo cuyas ramas alcanzó la sabiduría Buda. El templo se encuentra enclavado en medio de un extenso complejo de templos más pequeños, estatuas y caminos que atraviesan hermosos parques y apacibles lagos. Tanto él como sus alrededores siguen siendo un foco de la religión budista, y todos los años acude gente de todas partes de mundo para honrar a Buda y maravillarse ante la belleza del Mahabodhi.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Buddhist stupas are monuments holding holy relics. The first eight stupas were created to hold the Buddha's remains. During his reign, the Emperor Asoka took portions of the Buddha's ashes and spread them among the thousands of stupas he created. Stupas can now be found across Asia and the world.[PARAGRAPH:1]The oldest surviving stupa can be found in Sanchi, India. The "Great Stupa" was constructed by Emperor Asoka some time in the third century BC.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Les stupas bouddhistes sont des monuments abritant des reliques religieuses. Les huit premiers stupas ont été créés pour conserver celles de Bouddha. Pendant son règne, l'empereur Ashoka s'est emparé d'une partie des cendres de Bouddha pour les disperser dans les milliers de stupas qu'il avait créés. On trouve désormais des stupa dans toute l'Asie mais aussi dans le monde entier.[PARAGRAPH:1]Le plus vieux stupa se trouve à Sanci en Inde. Le "Grand Stupa" a été construit par l'empereur Ashoka, au IIIe siècle av. J.-C.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Buddhistische Stupas sind halbkugelförmige Grabhügel. Die ersten acht Stupas wurden errichtet, um Buddhas sterbliche Überreste aufzunehmen. Kaiser Ashoka verteilte Buddhas Asche später auf tausenden von Stupas. Heute findet man Stupas in aller Welt.[PARAGRAPH:1]Die älteste Stupa steht im indischen Sanchi. Die "Große Stupa" wurde von Kaiser Ashoka im 3. Jahrhundert vor Christus errichtet.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Gli stupa Buddisti sono dei monumenti che contengono delle reliquie sacre. I primi otto stupa vennero creati per conservare i resti di Budda. Durante il suo regno, l'Imperatore Ashoka prese parti delle ceneri di Budda e le suddivise nelle migliaia di stupa da lui edificati. Gli stupa si trovano principalmente in Asia.[PARAGRAPH:1]Lo stupa più antico del mondo si trova a Sanchi, in India. Il "grande stupa" fu costruito all'incirca nel III secolo a. C. dall'Imperatore Ashoka.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Los stupas budistas son monumentos que albergan reliquias sagradas. Los primeros ocho fueron creados para conservar los restos de Buda. Durante su reinado, el emperador Ashoka cogió parte de las cenizas de Buda y las diseminó entre los miles que creó. En la actualidad pueden encontrarse stupas en Asia y por todo el mundo.[PARAGRAPH:1]El stupa más antiguo del mundo se encuentra en Sanchi, la India. El "gran stupa" fue construido por el emperador Ashoka el algún momento del siglo III a. C.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The term "bunker" is often used to denote military bomb shelters, often those housing high officials of the military and government. As shown in the second United States-Iraq War, a country with air dominance over a foe can do significant amounts of damage to a city with just a few bombs. Military and political leaders are prime targets for such attacks; often these officials will be protected in bunkers far below city streets. Bunkers are also used to protect communications networks, another important target.[PARAGRAPH:1]Any improvement in defense usually sparks an improvement in offensive weapons. The United States is building special "bunker-buster" bombs, designed to burrow deep into the ground before exploding. While such bombs may not destroy the deepest bunkers, they can cut off their communications, escape routes and air supply.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le terme "bunker" est souvent utilisé pour désigner les abris antiaériens militaires abritant généralement les hauts responsables de l'armée et du gouvernement. Comme le montre la seconde guerre entre les Etats-Unis et l'Irak, lorsqu'un pays dispose d'un avantage aérien sur son ennemi, il peut faire des dégâts importants dans une ville avec peu de bombes. Les responsables militaires et politiques constituent les principales cibles de ces attaques. Ils se mettent donc souvent à l'abri dans des bunkers situés bien en dessous du niveau des rues de la ville. Les bunkers servent également à protéger les réseaux de communication qui constituent une autre cible majeure.[PARAGRAPH:1]Toute amélioration de la défense entraîne généralement une amélioration des armes offensives. Les Etats-Unis construisent actuellement des bombes spéciales "anti-bunker", conçues pour s'enfoncer profondément dans le sol avant d'exploser. Si ces bombes ne parviennent pas à détruire les bunkers les plus profonds, elles peuvent néanmoins couper les communications, les routes d'évacuation et l'alimentation en air.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Der Begriff "Bunker" bezeichnet im Allgemeinen Luftschutzkeller für hochrangige Mitglieder des Militärs und der Regierung. Der zweite Krieg zwischen den Vereinigten Staaten und dem Irak hat gezeigt, dass ein Land allein durch seine Lufthoheit einer Stadt mit nur wenigen Bomben schwere Schäden zufügen kann. Da militärische und politische Führer meist die Hauptziele eines Angriffs feindlicher Truppen sind, ziehen sie sich im Ernstfall in unterirdische Bunkersysteme zurück. Darüber hinaus sind in Bunkern nicht selten Kommunikationsnetzwerke und andere wichtige Ziele untergebracht.[PARAGRAPH:1]Jeder Fortschritt bei der Verteidigung bringt sofort verbesserte Angriffswaffen hervor. Inzwischen gibt es Spezialbomben für Angriffe auf Bunker (so genannte Bunker-Buster), die sich vor der Detonation tief in den Erdboden graben. Diese sind in der Lage, die Kommunikationssysteme, die Fluchtwege und die Luftversorgung einer Bunkeranlage abzuschneiden, auch wenn sie den Bunker selbst nicht immer zerstören.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Il termine "bunker" viene spesso utilizzato per indicare i rifugi anti bombardamento, spesso residenza degli alti ufficiali dell'esercito e del governo. Come mostrato nella seconda guerra tra Stati Uniti e Iraq, una nazione con una massiccia forza aerea è in grado di infliggere con poche bombe danni significativi a una città. I leader politici e militari sono i primi bersagli di questo genere di attacchi: spesso, questi ufficiali vengono protetti in bunker sotterranei costruiti sotto le strade cittadine. I bunker sono inoltre utilizzati per proteggere le reti di comunicazioni e altri obiettivi importanti.[PARAGRAPH:1]Ogni miglioramento nelle difese determina un miglioramento nelle armi offensive: gli Stati Uniti stanno realizzando delle bombe desinate all'eliminazione specifica dei bunker, pensate per raggiungere una buona profondità prima di detonare. Malgrado bombe di questo tipo possono non bastare per distruggere i bunker più in profondità, sono in grado di tagliare la rete di comunicazioni e danneggiare eventuali condotti d'aerazione e via di fuga.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Suele emplearse el término "búnker" para hacer referencia a un refugio militar, como los que suelen utilizar los altos funcionarios del ejército y el gobierno. Como quedó demostrado en la segunda guerra entre los Estados Unidos e Irak, un país que cuente con la supremacía aérea puede causar daños significativos a las ciudades de su enemigo con pocas bombas. Los líderes militares y políticos son objetivos primarios para este tipo de ataques. A menudo, estos personajes buscarán refugios en búnkeres situados bajo las calles. También se utilizan para proteger las comunicaciones, redes y otros objetivos importantes.[PARAGRAPH:1]Cualquier avance en la defensa suele desencadenar otro en el armamento ofensivo. Los Estados Unidos están desarrollando bombas especiales "antibúnker", diseñadas para hundirse profundamente en la tierra antes de estallar. Aunque es posible que no sean capaces de destruir los búnkeres más profundos, pueden interrumpir las comunicaciones, las vías de escape y el suministro aéreo.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Church of the Anastasis, also called the Church of the Resurrection or the Church of the Holy Sepulchre by Latin Christians, is a church within the Christian Quarter of the walled Old City of Jerusalem. It is a few steps away from the Muristan.[PARAGRAPH:1]The site is venerated as Calvary (Golgotha), where Jesus was crucified, and also contains the place where Jesus is said to have been buried. The church has been an important Christian pilgrimage destination since at least the 4th century as the purported site of the resurrection of Jesus.[PARAGRAPH:1]Today it also serves as the headquarters of the Greek Orthodox Patriarch of Jerusalem, while control of the building is shared between several Christian churches and secular entities in complicated arrangements essentially unchanged for centuries. Today, the church is home to branches of Eastern Orthodoxy and Oriental Orthodoxy as well as to Roman Catholicism. Anglicans and Protestants have no permanent presence in the Church and some have regarded the Garden Tomb, elsewhere in Jerusalem, as the true place of Jesus's crucifixion and resurrection.

[TAB]The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (colloquially known as the Mounties, and internally as 'the Force') is both a federal and a national police force of Canada, and one of the most recognized of its kind in the world. It is unique in the world as a national, federal, provincial, and municipal policing body. The RCMP provides policing services to all of Canada at a federal level, and also on a contract basis to the three territories, eight of Canada's provinces (the RCMP does not provide provincial or municipal policing in either Ontario or Quebec), more than 190 municipalities, 184 aboriginal communities, and three international airports.

[TAB]The Temple of Kukulkan (also known as El Castillo or the Temple of Quetzalcoatl) is one of the best-known Mayan buildings in Chichen Itza. The structure itself is a typical four-sided step temple, but at its base rests stone pillars carved with feathered serpents (revealing the strong Toltec/Aztec influence). Many archeologists believe that its design is based upon the Mayan calendar, since each stairway has 90 steps. Add the total steps to the number of stairways plus the top platform, and you reach the number of 365 (the number of days in [our] typical calendar year).
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le temple de Quetzalcóatl (aussi appelé la Citadelle ou le temple de Kukulcán) est l'un des bâtiments mayas les plus connus sur le site de Chichén Itzá. L'ouvrage est une simple pyramide à degrés à quatre côtés, mais on trouve à sa base des piliers en pierre sur lesquels sont gravés des serpents à plumes, révélant la forte influence toltèque et aztèque. Beaucoup d'archéologues pensent que ce temple fut conçu d'après le calendrier maya, car chaque escalier compte 90 marches. Si l'on fait le total des marches et des escaliers, et qu'on ajoute la plate-forme au sommet, on obtient le nombre 365, soit le nombre de jours d'une année civile classique.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Die Pyramide des Kukulcán (auch El Castillo oder Tempel des Quetzalcoatl genannt) ist eines der bekanntesten Maya-Bauwerke in Chichen Itza. Das Gebäude selbst ist eine typische vierseitige Stufenpyramide, an deren Fuß allerdings Steinsäulen mit eingemeißelten gefiederten Schlangen angebracht sind (was den starken toltekischen/aztekischen Einfluss widerspiegelt). Viele Archäologen glauben, dass dieses Design auf dem Maya-Kalender basiert, da jeder Treppenabschnitt 90 Stufen hat. Addiert man die Gesamtzahl der Stufen und zählt dann die Anzahl der Treppenabschnitte plus der Dachplattform hinzu, so erhält man die Zahl 365 (die Anzahl der Tage in [unserem] gewöhnlichen Kalenderjahr).
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Il Tempio di Kukulcan (conosciuto anche come El Castillo o Tempio di Quetzalcoatl) è uno degli edifici maya meglio conosciuti di Chichen Itza. La struttura è quella tipica di un tempo con quattro lati, ma alla base si trovano colonne di pietra scolpite con serpenti piumati (che rivelano la forte influenza tolteca/azteca). Molti archeologi credono che il progetto si basi sul calendario maya, visto che ogni scala ha 90 scalini. Sommando il numero di scalini delle quattro scale a quelli della piattaforma sovrastante si ottiene 365 (il numero di giorni nel [nostro] anno).
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El Templo de Kukulcán (también conocido como "El Castillo" o el "Templo de Quetzalcoatl") es uno de los edificios mayas más conocidos de Chichen Itzá. La estructura en sí es un templo típico con cuatro paredes inclinadas y con escalones, pero en su base descansan unos pilares de piedra grabados con serpientes emplumadas (lo cual evidencia la fuerte influencia tolteca/azteca). Muchos arqueólogos creen que su diseño está basado en el calendario maya, pues todas las escaleras tienen noventa peldaños. Al sumar el número de peldaños al de escaleras y a la plataforma superior, obtenemos los 365 días que tiene el año según nuestro calendario.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The CN Tower is a 553 m-high (1,815 ft) concrete communications and observation tower in Downtown Toronto, Ontario, Canada. Built on the former Railway Lands, it was completed in 1976, becoming the world's tallest free-standing structure and world's tallest tower at the time. It held both records for 34 years until the completion of Burj Khalifa and Canton Tower in 2010. It remains the tallest free-standing structure in the Western Hemisphere, a signature icon of Toronto's skyline, and a symbol of Canada, attracting more than two million international visitors annually.[PARAGRAPH:1]Its name "CN" originally referred to Canadian National, the railway company that built the tower. Following the railway's decision to divest non-core freight railway assets, prior to the company's privatization in 1995, it transferred the tower to the Canada Lands Company, a federal Crown corporation responsible for real estate development. Since the name CN Tower became common in daily usage, the abbreviation was eventually expanded to Canadian National Tower or Canada's National Tower. However, neither of these names is commonly used.[PARAGRAPH:1]In 1995, the CN Tower was declared one of the modern Seven Wonders of the World by the American Society of Civil Engineers. It also belongs to the World Federation of Great Towers, where it holds second-place ranking.

[TAB]Hacienda is a Spanish word for an estate. Some haciendas were plantations, mines or factories. Many haciendas combined these productive activities. The hacienda aimed for self-sufficiency in everything but luxuries meant for display, which were destined for the handful of people in the circle of the patrón, also known as the hacendado.[PARAGRAPH:1]Haciendas originated in land grants, mostly made to conquistadors. It is in Mexico that the hacienda system can be considered to have its origin in 1529, when the Spanish crown granted to Hernán Cortés the title of Marquess of the Valley of Oaxaca, which entailed a tract of land that included all of the present state of Morelos. Significantly, Cortés was also granted an encomienda, which included all the Native Americans then living on the land, and with power of life and death every person on his domains.

[TAB]Throughout the history of Imperial China, strong emphasis has been placed on a rigorous education of its bureaucrats and officials. By tradition, this education has been inextricably linked to the values of Confucianism. Guozijian are large imperial academies where future officials are trained in those Confucian tenets.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Durch die gesamte Geschichte des kaiserlichen China wurde gro�er Wert auf die rigorose Ausbildung von B�rokraten und Staatsvertretern gelegt. Der Tradition nach war diese Ausbildung untrennbar mit konfuzianischen Werten verbunden. Guozijian sind gro�e kaiserliche Akademien, in denen angehende Beamte in diesen konfuzianischen Ansichten ausgebildet werden.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Many of the early Confucian religious buildings were destroyed during the Qin Dynasty. When the Emperor Wu (156-87 BC) adopted Confucianism as the state religion of China, he placed many Confucian scholars in positions of power; eventually, knowledge of Confucianism became a prerequisite for anyone hoping to gain employment in the Imperial government. Private and public Confucian Academies sprung up across China, where families sent their sons to study for the civil service examinations.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Bon nombre des premiers édifices confucianistes ont été détruits sous la dynastie Qin. Lorsque l'empereur Wudi (140-87 av. J.-C.) adopte le confucianisme comme religion d'Etat en Chine, il nomme de nombreux érudits confucianistes à des postes de pouvoir. La connaissance du confucianisme finit par devenir un préalable pour espérer travailler pour le gouvernement impérial. Des académies confucianistes publiques et privées sont apparues partout en Chine. C'est là que les familles envoyaient leurs fils étudier pour passer les examens de la fonction publique.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Viele frühe konfuzianische Gebäude wurden während der Qin-Dynastie zerstört. Als Kaiser Wu (156-87 vor Christus) den Konfuzianismus als Staatsreligion annahm, berief er unzählige Anhänger des Konfuzianismus in hohe Ämter. Später war der Konfuzianismus sogar die Voraussetzung für eine Beamtenlaufbahn. In ganz China entstanden daraufhin private und öffentliche Akademien, in denen junge Männer auf den Staatsdienst vorbereitet wurden.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Molti dei primi edifici di culto dedicati a Confucio furono distrutti durante la dinastia dei Qin. Quando l'Imperatore Wu (156-87 BC) scelse come religione ufficiale della Cina il Confucianesimo, gli anziani di questa religione vennero messi in posizioni di potere. Successivamente, la conoscenza del Confucianesimo divenne una prerogativa necessaria per potere entrare a far parte del governo Imperiale. Le accademie del Confucianesimo, private e pubbliche, si diffusero rapidamente in tutta la Cina: qui le famiglie mandavano i propri figli a studiare per poter partecipare agli esami statali.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Muchos de los edificios confucionistas más antiguos fueron destruidos en tiempos de la dinastía Qin. Cuando el emperador Wu (156-87 a. C.) adoptó el confucianismo como religión de estado en China, colocó a muchos de sus seguidores en posiciones de poder; con el tiempo, el conocimiento de esta religión se convirtió en un requisito para cualquiera que aspirase a conseguir un puesto en la burocracia imperial. Por toda China aparecieron academias confucionistas públicas y privadas, adonde las familias enviaban a sus hijos para preparar los exámenes de ingreso en la administración civil.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The San Kong are the three Confucian holy sites located in the city Qufu in China's Shandong province: the Kong Family Mansion, the Cemetary of Confucius, and most prominently, the Kong Miao or Temple of Confucius. The origins of the temple date back to 478 BC, when a local ruler built a temple to honor Confucius (who had only recently passed away and was relatively unknown in most of China). As time passed and the fame of Confucius began to spread, the Kong Miao grew in stature and importance as well. The Han Emperor Wu Di offered sacrifices at the site in 205 BC, and the Kong Miao continued to be patronized by various emperors across the centuries.[PARAGRAPH:1]The actual buildings that make up the San Kong have been torn down and rebuilt many times over the centuries. The present layout of the Kong Miao dates to the early 16th century, when the temple was rebuilt following a massive conflaguration in 1499 sparked by lightning. Since this construction took place at the same time as Beijing's Forbidden Palace, there are many design similarities between the two complexes. The Kong Miao is known not only for its size (it comprises some 466 rooms), but also for its stone sculptures and calligraphy dating back to many different dynasties. Today it is both a holy Confucian shrine and a popular tourist attraction.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Die San Kong sind die drei konfuzianischen heiligen St�tten in der Stadt Qufu in der chinesischen Provinz Shandong: das Familienanwesen der Kong, der Friedhof von Konfuzius und am bedeutendsten, der Kong Miao oder Tempel von Konfuzius. Der Tempel wurde im Jahr 478 vor Christus von einem regionalen Fürsten zu Ehren Konfuzius' (der im übrigen China damals noch weitgehend unbekannt war) errichtet. Als Konfuzius über die Grenzen der Provinz hinaus bekannt wurde, gewann der Kong Miao mehr und mehr an Bedeutung. Der Han-Kaiser Wu Di brachte im Jahr 205 vor Christus mehrere Opfer dar und auch in den folgenden Jahrhunderten suchten zahlreiche Herrscher den Kong Miao auf.[PARAGRAPH:1]Der eigentlichen Geb�ude der San Kong wurden im Laufe der Zeit mehrmals zerstört und wieder aufgebaut. Das heutige Gebäude des Kong Miao stammt aus dem frühen 16. Jahrhundert, nachdem der alte Tempel im Jahr 1499 einem Feuer zum Opfer gefallen war. Da der Kong Miao etwa zeitgleich mit der verbotenen Stadt in Peking errichtet wurde, verbinden beide Anlagen verschiedene architektonische Gemeinsamkeiten. Der Kong Miao ist ob seiner Größe (er hat immerhin 466 Räume) und seiner Steinskulpturen berühmt. Die dort aufbewahrten Kalligrafien gehen auf verschiedene chinesische Herrscherdynastien zurück. Heute ist der Kong Miao ein konfuzianisches Heiligtum und eine beliebte Touristenattraktion.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Though Confucius himself was a philosopher rather than a religious leader, over time he was accorded the status of a god and worshipped across Asia. The temples of Confucius are referred to as Kong Miao. Some of them are small and private, others more extensive where hundreds of worshippers could attend services. Many Miao were constructed in the pagoda style of architecture.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Obwohl Konfuzius selbst eher ein Philosoph als ein Religionsstifter war, wurde er in weiten Teilen Asiens als Gott verehrt. Diese Konfuzius-Tempel werden als Kong Miao bezeichnet. Einige von ihnen sind klein und privat, andere so aufwendig, dass Hunderte von Gl�ubigen Zeremonien beiwohnen k�nnen. Viele dieser Miao wurden im typischen Pagodenstil erbaut.

TEXT.English: [TAB]A Customs House is an organization responsible for collecting taxes on imports or exports, as well as for seizing contraband. Customs Houses were common during the Age of Sail, when the level of trade skyrocketed and the necessity for a centralized system of tax collection arose. In Spain, with the huge influx of wealth from the New World, Sevilla was designated the "Customs City" where all transports carrying Incan or Aztec gold were required to land so that the Crown could take its share. Tariffs became a hotly-debated topic in the New World, especially in the English colonies, where tariffs would fan the flames of several of that region's most violent conflicts.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le poste de douane est l'organisation chargée de collecter des taxes sur les importations ou les exportations, ainsi que de saisir les produits de contrebande. Les postes de douane sont courants pendant la période des grandes explorations, alors même que le niveau des échanges commerciaux grimpe en flèche et que la nécessité d'un système centralisé pour la collecte des taxes commence à se faire sentir. Avec l'immense influx de richesses en provenance du Nouveau monde, l'Espagne a l'idée de désigner Séville "ville des douanes" et d'obliger tous les navires transportant de l'or inca ou aztèque à s'y arrêter, afin que la couronne puisse prélever sa part. Les tarifs douaniers deviennent un sujet de débat brûlant au sein du Nouveau monde, surtout dans les colonies anglaises, où ils vont attiser des conflits extrêmement violents.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Ein Zollamt ist eine Institution, die dafür zuständig ist, Steuern auf Importe und Exporte zu erheben und Schmuggelware zu beschlagnahmen. Zollämter gab es häufig im Zeitalter der Entdeckungen, als das Handelsvolumen in die Höhe schoss und die Notwendigkeit für ein zentrales Steuererhebungssystem entstand. In Spanien, mit dem großen Einfluss des Reichtums aus der Neuen Welt, wurde Sevilla zur Zollstadt ernannt, und alle Transporte mit Gold der Inkas oder Azteken mussten hier Halt machen, um der Krone ihren Anteil abzutreten. Zolltarife wurden zu einem heiß diskutierten Thema in der Neuen Welt, speziell in den englischen Kolonien, wo die Gebühren einige der gewaltsamsten Konflikte der Region schürten.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]La Dogana è un'organizzazione responsabile della riscossione delle tasse su importazioni ed esportazioni, oltre che della confisca delle merci di contrabbando. Le Dogane erano comuni durante l'era della navigazione a vela, quando il livello del commercio decollò e nacque la necessità di un sistema centralizzato di riscossione delle tasse. In Spagna, con l'enorme flusso di entrate provenienti dal Nuovo Mondo, Sevilla era considerata la "città della Dogana", dove tutte le navi che trasportavano oro inca o azteco dovevano fermarsi affinché la Corona potesse prendere la sua parte. Le tariffe divennero un argomento molto discusso, nel Nuovo Mondo, specialmente nelle colonie inglesi, dove avrebbero alimentato la fiamma di molti dei più violenti conflitti di quella regione.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Las aduanas son las instituciones responsables de cobrar los impuestos a la importación y la exportación, así como de requisar el contrabando. Su uso se generalizó durante la "era de la vela", cuando el volumen de los intercambios mercantiles se elevó exponencialmente y empezó a hacerse sentir la necesidad de un sistema de recaudación centralizado. En España, con la entrada de las enormes riquezas del Nuevo Mundo, Sevilla se convirtió en la "Casa de contratación", a donde debía transportarse todo el oro inca o azteca para que la Corona pudiera quedarse con su parte. Los aranceles y tarifas se convirtieron en objeto de controversia en el Nuevo Mundo, sobre todo en las colonias inglesas, donde provocarían el estallido de algunos de los más violentos conflictos de la región.

TEXT.English: [TAB]An arena is an open-air venue used for entertainment, performances, and sports.[PARAGRAPH:1]Ancient Greek theatres were built in a semicircle, with tiered seating above a performance area. Ancient Roman arenas were oval or circular in plan, with seating tiers that surrounded the central performance area, like a modern open-air stadium. Modern usage for "arena" is lax, and does not always respect the ancient usage, and so the word can be found describing theatre-style stages with the audience only on one side, theatres in the round, and stadiums. Natural formations shaped like man-made theatres are sometimes known as natural arenas. The three largest Roman arenas (in the original sense) in the world in order of size are the Colosseum, the Amphitheatre Campania and the Amphitheatre of El Djem.

[TAB]The Empire State Building is a 102-story landmark Art Deco skyscraper in New York City at the intersection of Fifth Avenue and West 34th Street. Its name is derived from the nickname for New York, The Empire State. It stood as the world's tallest building for more than 40 years, from its completion in 1931 until construction of the World Trade Center's North Tower was completed in 1972. Following the terrorist bombing and destruction of the World Trade Center in 2001, the Empire State Building again became the tallest building in New York City.

[TAB]The Mesoamerican "Ball Game" (no native name has ever surfaced for the sport) originated in Southern Mexico, roughly two thousand years before the Common Era. By the time of the arrival of the Spanish, the game had become popular throughout Mexico, Guatemala and Belize, drawing crowds from both the upper echelons of society and the masses.[PARAGRAPH:1]While much of the game is still not understood, what is known is that two teams of two to four players each took to the field with the goal of keeping a small, rubber ball in the air by bouncing it off arms, hips and thighs. How the winner was decided is not known, but we do know that the losers often became the next sacrifice to the gods.[PARAGRAPH:1]The Ball Court held a deep religious significance for the Maya. Mayan Kings would often reenact a famous game between the God of the Underworld and the Heroes from the Popol Vuh, a Mayan sacred text. The King's victory on the Ball Court was said to be an omen of the continued survival of his city.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le "jeu de balle" mésoaméricain (aucun nom maya n'a été retrouvé pour ce jeu) est originaire du sud du Mexique et fut inventé environ deux mille ans avant notre ère. A l'arrivée des Espagnols, ce jeu est populaire à travers le Mexique, le Guatemala et le Belize et attire des foules issues à la fois de l'élite et des masses populaires.[PARAGRAPH:1]Bien qu'une grande partie du jeu reste incompréhensible, nous savons que deux équipes de deux à quatre joueurs doivent se renvoyer une balle en caoutchouc. Pour cela, ils peuvent utiliser les bras, les jambes et les hanches. On ignore comment est désigné le vainqueur, mais l'on sait que les perdants sont souvent sacrifiés aux dieux.[PARAGRAPH:1]Le terrain de jeu revêt une signification religieuse importante pour les Mayas. Les rois mayas reproduisent souvent une célèbre partie de jeu de balle ayant prétendument eu lieu entre les dieux des Enfers et les héros du Popol Vuh, un texte sacré maya. La victoire du roi sur le terrain était censée être de bon augure pour la survie de la cité.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Das mesoamerikanische "Ballspiel" (der wahre Name dieser Sportart ist unbekannt) entstand ungefähr zweitausend Jahre vor Christi Geburt im Süden Mexikos. Bei der Ankunft der Spanier hatte das Spiel in ganz Mexiko, Guatemala und Belize an Beliebtheit gewonnen und zog Zuschauer aus den höchsten Schichten der Bevölkerung ebenso an wie die breite Masse.[PARAGRAPH:1]Obwohl nicht viel über das Spiel bekannt ist, weiß man, dass es zwei Mannschaften aus zwei bis vier Spielern gab, die auf dem Feld versuchten, einen kleinen Gummiball in der Luft zu halten, indem sie ihn von Armen, Hüften und Oberschenkeln abprallen ließen. Wie der Gewinner ermittelt wurde, ist unbekannt, aber wir wissen, dass die Verlierer oft das nächste Opfer für die Götter darstellten.[PARAGRAPH:1]Der Ballplatz war für die Maya von tiefer religiöser Bedeutung. Mayakönige ließen oft ein berühmtes Spiel zwischen dem Gott der Unterwelt und den Helden aus dem Popol Vuh, einem heiligen Text der Maya, nachstellen. War der König auf dem Ballplatz siegreich, galt dies als gutes Omen für den Fortbestand seiner Stadt.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Il "gioco della palla" dell'America centrale (di cui non è mai stato scoperto il nome originale) ebbe origine nel Messico del sud, circa 2000 anni prima di Cristo. All'arrivo degli spagnoli il gioco era diventato popolare in tutto il Messico, Guatemala e Belize, e attirava folle sia dalle masse sia dalle classi più abbienti della società.[PARAGRAPH:1]Ancora molto è sconosciuto di questo gioco, ma si sa che si affrontavano due squadre da due a quattro giocatori ognuna e lo scopo era mantenere in aria una palla gommosa facendola rimbalzare su braccia, fianchi e cosce. Non ci è dato di sapere come si decidesse il vincitore, ma sappiamo che spesso i perdenti diventavano un sacrificio per gli dei.[PARAGRAPH:1]Il Campo da palla aveva un profondo significato religioso per i Maya. I re spesso riproducevano una famosa partita giocata tra il Dio dell'Aldilà e gli eroi del Popol Vuh, un testo sacro dei Maya. La vittoria dei re sul Campo da palla si diceva fosse un buon presagio per la sopravvivenza della sua città.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El "juego de pelota" mesoamericano (no se ha descubierto el nombre nativo del juego), se originó en el sur de México, unos dos mil años antes de nuestra era. A la llegada de los españoles a América, el juego se había extendido por todo México, Guatemala y Belice, y atraía a numerosos espectadores, tanto de las capas superiores de la sociedad como de las masas.[PARAGRAPH:1]Aunque aún no entendemos el juego en su totalidad, lo que sí sabemos es que dos equipos de entre dos y cuatro jugadores se enfrentaban en el campo con el objetivo de mantener una pequeña pelota de caucho en el aire haciéndola rebotar en los brazos, las caderas y los muslos. No sabemos cómo se determinaba el ganador, pero sí que, muchas veces, los perdedores acababan como víctimas propiciatorias para los sacrificios.[PARAGRAPH:1]El campo del juego de pelota tenía un profundo significado religioso para los mayas. Los reyes mayas solían recrear un famoso partido entre el dios del Infierno y los héroes del Popol Vuh, un texto sagrado. Se creía que la victoria de los reyes en este enfrentamiento era un buen augurio para la supervivencia de la ciudad.

TEXT.English: [TAB]As cities grew and prospered, trade between the farmers, artisans, and craftsmen who lived in the vicinity contributed to the economic health of the city. It soon became apparent that the best way for conducting trade within the city was to have a central location, or marketplace, where the people offering goods and services, or seeking them, could meet and conduct business. As a cities marketplace grew larger and more active, the economic vitality of the city grew as well.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Lorsque les villes se sont agrandies et ont prospéré, le commerce entre les fermiers et les artisans des environs a contribué à la bonne santé économique de la ville. Rapidement, il est apparu que le meilleur moyen d'attirer le commerce dans la ville consistait à créer un emplacement central, une place du marché, où la population pouvait échanger ses biens et services, se rencontrer et faire des affaires. Lorsque la place du marché d'un village s'agrandissait et devenait plus active, la vitalité économique de la ville augmentait également.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Je mehr eine Stadt sich vergrößerte, desto mehr trug der Handel zwischen Bauern, Kunsthandwerkern und Handwerkern, die im Stadtgebiet oder der näheren Umgebung ansässig waren, zum städtischen Wohlstand bei. Schnell erkannte man, dass es sinnvoll war, einen zentralen Ort - einen Marktplatz - für Handelsaktivitäten bereitzustellen. Hier konnten sich alle Bürger einfinden, die Waren und Dienstleistungen anboten oder suchten, um ihre Geschäfte zu tätigen. Je mehr ein Marktplatz genutzt wurde, desto stärker wurde auch die wirtschaftliche Situation der Stadt.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Quando le città crescevano e prosperavano, il commercio fra gli agricoltori, gli artigiani e gli artisti che vivevano nelle vicinanze contribuiva al benessere economico della città. Divenne presto chiaro che il modo migliore per condurre questi scambi nella città era di avere un'area centrale, il mercato, in cui la gente che offriva beni e servizi, oppure li cercava, potesse incontrarsi per condurre i suoi affari. Quando il mercato diventava più grande e più attraente in una città, anche la vitalità di quest'ultima ne risentiva positivamente.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]A medida que las ciudades crecían y prosperaban, el comercio entre los agricultores y artesanos que vivían en sus inmediaciones contribuía a su salud económica. Pronto se hizo evidente que la mejor manera de llevar a cabo el intercambio en la ciudad era con un lugar central o mercado en el que pudiera reunirse la gente que ofrecía mercancías o servicios y la que iba en busca de los mismos. A medida que el mercado de la ciudad crecía y su actividad se intensificaba, la vitalidad económica también aumentaba.

TEXT.English: [TAB]A lighthouse is a tower constructed on the shoreline, usually near a harbor or busy waterway. A powerful light sits atop the tower, making the structure visible to mariners for miles around. Lighthouses are built to mark the location of rocks and shoals or other hazards in the dead of night or midst of storms. Before the invention of radar, electricity, and global positioning systems, any vessel sailing near the shore ran a risk of running into such hazards and sinking. Naturally, sailors preferred to sail to destinations that had a method of marking these perils, so harbors with lighthouses flourished.[PARAGRAPH:1]The original "lighthouse" was probably a bonfire lit by villagers to guide the village's fishing vessels back to harbor at night. Over time people realized that the fires could be seen much farther away if they were built atop platforms or towers. Further improvements were made as technology advanced; mirrors were built to direct the light in the desired directions; oil lamps replaced the more dangerous bonfires, which were in turn replaced by electric lamps.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Un phare est une tour construite sur la côte, généralement à proximité d'un port ou d'une voie navigable fréquentée. Une puissante lumière est allumée en haut de la tour afin que les marins puissent la voir à des kilomètres à la ronde. Les phares servent à indiquer l'emplacement de rochers, de bas-fonds et autres dangers au coeur de la nuit ou au milieu des tempêtes. Avant l'invention du radar, de l'électricité et des systèmes de navigation et de localisation par GPS, tout vaisseau navigant à proximité des côtes courait le risque de se heurter à ces dangers et de couler.
