TEXT.English: [TAB]The lion (Panthera leo) is one of the five big cats in the genus Panthera and a member of the family Felidae. With some males exceeding 250 kg (550 lb) in weight, it is the second-largest living cat after the tiger. Wild lions currently exist in sub-Saharan Africa and in Asia (where an endangered remnant population resides in Gir Forest National Park in India) while other types of lions have disappeared from North Africa and Southwest Asia in historic times. Until the late Pleistocene, about 10,000 years ago, the lion was the most widespread large land mammal after humans. They were found in most of Africa, across Eurasia from western Europe to India, and in the Americas from the Yukon to Peru. The lion is a vulnerable species, having seen a major population decline in its African range of 30-50% per two decades during the second half of the 20th century. Lion populations are untenable outside designated reserves and national parks. Although the cause of the decline is not fully understood, habitat loss and conflicts with humans are currently the greatest causes of concern. Within Africa, the West African lion population is particularly endangered.[PARAGRAPH:1]Lions live for 10-14 years in the wild, while in captivity they can live longer than 20 years. In the wild, males seldom live longer than 10 years, as injuries sustained from continual fighting with rival males greatly reduce their longevity. They typically inhabit savanna and grassland, although they may take to bush and forest. Lions are unusually social compared to other cats. A pride of lions consists of related females and offspring and a small number of adult males. Groups of female lions typically hunt together, preying mostly on large ungulates. Lions are apex and keystone predators, although they are also expert scavengers obtaining over 50 percent of their food by scavenging as opportunity allows. While lions do not typically hunt humans, some have been known to do so. Sleeping mainly during the day, lions are primarily nocturnal, although bordering on crepuscular in nature.[PARAGRAPH:1]Highly distinctive, the male lion is easily recognised by its mane, and its face is one of the most widely recognised animal symbols in human culture. Depictions have existed from the Upper Paleolithic period, with carvings and paintings from the Lascaux and Chauvet Caves, through virtually all ancient and medieval cultures where they once occurred. It has been extensively depicted in sculptures, in paintings, on national flags, and in contemporary films and literature. Lions have been kept in menageries since the time of the Roman Empire, and have been a key species sought for exhibition in zoos over the world since the late eighteenth century. Zoos are cooperating worldwide in breeding programs for the endangered Asiatic subspecies.

[TAB]Modern armor's goal is to provide versatile firepower that can operate in any battlefield condition, while at the same time ensuring the safety of its crew. Sophisticated electronics allows modern tanks to operate in any weather, day or night, with no significant performance degradation. Capable of nearly 50 mph in rugged terrain, these fighting vehicles are often in the 50-60 ton range. Though their firepower varies, most of these advanced tracked vehicles are equipped with 100mm+ cannons, in addition to other smaller caliber machine guns. Depending on the assignment, some versions include "reactive" armor, which helps to thwart the advanced armor-penetrating munitions seen on today's battlefields.
TEXT.French: [TAB]L'objectif des blindés modernes est de fournir une puissance de feu polyvalente, capable d'intervenir quelles que soient les conditions de bataille tout en offrant une protection efficace à l'équipage. Des systèmes électroniques sophistiqués permettent aux blindés d'agir par tous types de temps, de jour comme de nuit, sans perdre de leur efficacité. Pouvant se déplacer à près de 80 km/h sur des terrains accidentés, ces véhicules de combat pèsent souvent dans les 50 à 60 tonnes. Bien que leur puissance de feu soit variable, la plupart des blindés sont équipés de canons de plus de 100mm et de mitrailleuses. Certains modèles disposent également de blindages "réactifs", capables de neutraliser les projectiles perforants modernes.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Die Hauptaufgabe des Kampfpanzers besteht darin, in jeder Kampfsituation seine vielseitig einsetzbare Feuerkraft zur Verfügung zu stellen und gleichzeitig die Sicherheit seiner Besatzung zu gewährleisten. Dank hoch entwickelter Elektronik ist es modernen Panzern möglich, Tag und Nacht bei jeder Witterung ohne nennenswerte Leistungseinbußen zu operieren. Mit einer Spitzengeschwindigkeit von nahezu 80 Stundenkilometern auf schwergängigem Gelände besitzen diese Kampffahrzeuge häufig ein Gefechtsgewicht von 50-60 Tonnen. Ihre Feuerkraft variiert je nach Fahrzeugtyp, aber die meisten modernen Kettenfahrzeuge sind mit mindestens 100-mm-Kanonen ausgestattet, und das zusätzlich zu den kleinkalibrigeren MGs. Je nach Einsatzbestimmung verfügen manche dieser Gefährte außerdem über eine "reaktive" (Mehrschicht-)Panzerung, die dazu dient, die modernen Durchschlagsgeschosse abzuwehren, welche auf den Kriegsschauplätzen der heutigen Zeit zum Einsatz kommen.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]L'obiettivo delle unità corazzate moderne è di fornire una potenza di fuoco versatile, che possa operare in qualsiasi condizione sul campo di battaglia, assicurando al tempo stesso l'incolumità dell'equipaggio. Sofisticati apparecchi elettronici consentono ai carri armati moderni di operare in qualsiasi condizione meteorologica, di giorno o di notte, senza penalizzazioni significative dal punto di vista delle prestazioni. In grado di viaggiare a circa 80 Km/h su terreno accidentato, questi veicoli da combattimento pesano spesso fra le 50 e le 60 tonnellate. Malgrado la loro potenza di fuoco sia variabile, la maggior parte di questi sofisticati veicoli corazzati è equipaggiata con cannoni da oltre 100mm, oltre a mitragliatrici di calibro minore. A seconda dell'assegnazione, alcune versioni dispongono di una corazza "reattiva", che può respingere le munizioni in grado di penetrare la corazza, tipiche dei campi di battaglia odierni.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El objetivo de los carros blindados modernos es proporcionar una potencia de fuego versátil, capaz de operar en cualquier condición, garantizando al mismo tiempo la seguridad de su dotación. Unos sistemas electrónicos muy sofisticados permiten a los tanques modernos operar en cualquier clima, de día o de noche, sin merma apreciable de su capacidad. Capaces de alcanzar una velocidad de 80 km/h a campo abierto, estos vehículos suelen pesar entre cincuenta y sesenta toneladas. Aunque su potencia de fuego varía, la mayoría de los vehículos de oruga modernos están equipados con cañones de 100 mm o más, además de ametralladoras de menor calibre. Según la misión asignada, algunas versiones cuentan con blindaje "reactivo", que ayuda a contrarrestar la potencia de las municiones penetrantes que se emplean en los campos de batalla de nuestros tiempos.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Rurales was the name commonly used to designate the Mexican Guardia Rural (Rural Guard): a force of mounted police or gendarmerie that existed between 1861 and 1914. In modern Mexico the name is applied to members of a part-time rural defense corps.[PARAGRAPH:1]The image of the Rurales as a ruthless and efficient organisation, which seldom took prisoners under the notorious ley fuga and inevitably got its man, was deliberately fostered under the Porfirian regime. However, research during the 1970s involving detailed examination of the records of the corps indicated that the Rurales were neither as effective nor as brutal as regime publicists had suggested. Never numbering more than about 4,000 men located in small detachments, the Rurales were too thinly spread to ever completely eliminate unrest in the Mexican countryside. They did however impose a superficial order, especially in the central regions around Mexico City, which encouraged the foreign investment sought by Díaz and his científico advisers . To a certain extent the regime saw the Rurales as a counterweight to the much larger Federal army and in the later years of the regime they were increasingly used to control industrial unrest, in addition to their traditional task of patrolling country areas.

[TAB]These four-masted sailing ships were the first European ships able to reliably navigate the open ocean. Although small by modern standards, the Carrack afforded enough space for crew, cargo and small cannons. Because the ship rose high out of the water it was near impossible for smaller ships to board a carrack. This size was a double edged sword, and due to its height Carracks were prone to capsize in strong winds. The Carrack was used most prominently by the Portuguese and Spanish during their explorations in the 15th and 16th centuries. The Santa Maria, the ship that carried Columbus to the New World, was a Carrack.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Ces navires à quatre mâts sont les premiers bateaux européens capables de naviguer sur l'océan. Bien que petite selon les critères modernes, la caraque offre assez d'espace pour abriter un équipage, une cargaison et quelques petits canons. Ce bateau s'élève bien au-dessus de la mer, il est donc presque impossible pour les plus petits navires de l'aborder. Cette taille ne présente pas que des avantages car les caraques sont enclines à chavirer en cas de grand vent. La caraque est surtout utilisée par les Portugais et les Espagnols au cours de leurs explorations des 15ème et 16ème siècles. La Santa Maria, le vaisseau qui transporta Christophe Colomb jusqu'au Nouveau monde, était une caraque.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Diese Vier-Mast-Segelschiffe waren die ersten europäischen Schiffe, die in der Lage waren, zuverlässig auf dem offenen Meer zu fahren. Obwohl sie nach modernen Maßstäben klein war, bot die Karacke genug Platz für Mannschaft, Fracht und kleine Kanonen. Da das Schiff hoch aus dem Wasser ragte, war es für kleinere Schiffe beinahe unmöglich anzugreifen. Diese Höhe war ein zweischneidiges Schwert, da die Karacke daher auch bei starken Winden zum Kentern neigte. Die Karacke wurde vor allem von den Portugiesen und Spaniern bei ihren Entdeckungsreisen im 15. und 16. Jahrhundert genutzt. Die Santa Maria, das Schiff, das Kolumbus in die Neue Welt brachte, war eine Karacke.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Queste navi a quattro alberi furono le prime imbarcazioni europee in grado di navigare in sicurezza nell'oceano aperto. Anche se piccole, secondo gli standard moderni, le Caracche avevano abbastanza spazio da ospitare equipaggio, carico e piccoli cannoni. A causa dell'altezza delle murate era quasi impossibile, per navi più piccole, abbordare una Caracca. Le dimensioni erano una spada a doppio taglio, però, proprio a causa dell'altezza, infatti, le Caracche tendevano a capovolgersi in caso di venti troppo forti. La Caracca venne usata principalmente da Portoghesi e Spagnoli durante le esplorazioni del 15° e 16° secolo. La Santa Maria, la nave che portò Colombo nel Nuovo Mondo, era una Caracca.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Estas naves de cuatro mástiles fueron los primeros barcos europeos capaces de aventurarse sin peligro en mar abierta. Aunque pequeñas según los estándares modernos, las carracas contaban con espacio suficiente para alojar a la tripulación, el cargamento y varios cañones de pequeño tamaño. Tenían la borda tan elevada que para las demás naves era casi imposible abordarlas. Sin embargo, esto resultaba ser un arma de doble filo, puesto que las hacía muy vulnerables a los vientos fuertes. Tanto los españoles como los portugueses las utilizaron con frecuencia durante sus exploraciones en los siglos XV y XVI. La Santa María, una de las naves que Colón llevó al Nuevo Mundo, era una carraca.

TEXT.English: [TAB](Wikipedia) West Indiaman was a general name for any merchantman sailing ship making runs from the Old World to the West Indies and the east coast of the Americas. These ships were generally strong ocean-going ships capable of handling storms in the Atlantic Ocean. The term was used to refer to vessels belonging to the Danish, Dutch, English, and French (e.g. Indispensable) West India companies.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Mohican Rifler represents the warriors of the five nations that took up arms during the French and Indian Wars and sided with the British. Made famous in Cooper's novel "Last of the Mohicans," these warriors were legendary for their forced marches through wilderness and combat skills in North America's thick forests. Regiments of Mohawk Riflers supplemented the British garrisons at Forts Owens and William Henry during the war.

[TAB]The Dog Soldiers were the elite of the Cheyenne warriors and some of the most feared fighters in the American West. Members of a prestigious fraternal society, the Dog Soldiers each received a "Dog Sash" upon entrance into the group. While at first merely emblems of membership, the "Dog Sash" soon became a symbol of iron will in combat. This reputation stemmed from the Dog Soldier habit of, during particularly brutal combat, staking themselves to the ground by way of their "Dog Sash" and not moving from the spot until victory or death had overtaken them.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Les soldats chiens étaient l'élite des guerriers cheyennes et comptaient parmi les guerriers les plus redoutés de l'Ouest américain. Membres d'une prestigieuse confrérie, ces soldats cheyennes recevaient chacun un long pagne appelé "ceinture du chien" en entrant dans ce groupe. Au départ, il ne s'agissait que d'un emblème communautaire, mais la "ceinture du chien" devint rapidement synonyme d'ardeur guerrière. En effet, lorsque les soldats chiens livraient une bataille difficile, ils se "clouaient" au sol grâce à leur pagne et des flèches, et ne bougeaient plus jusqu'à la victoire ou la mort.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Dog Soldiers waren die Elitekrieger der Cheyenne und gehörten zu den gefürchtetsten Kämpfern im amerikanischen Westen. Bei seiner Aufnahme in die Bruderschaft erhielt jeder Dog Soldier eine Schärpe aus Büffelleder, den so genannten "Dog Sash". Während er anfangs lediglich ein Mitgliedszeichen war, wurde der Dog Sash bald zum Zeichen eisernen Kampfeswillens. Dieser Ruf rührte vom Brauch der Dog Soldiers, ihre Schärpe bei besonders aussichtslosen Kämpfen mit einem Holzpflock am Boden festzunageln und sich nicht von der Stelle zu rühren, bis sie entweder siegreich oder tot waren.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]I Soldati cane erano l'elite dei guerrieri Cheyenne e fra i più temuti combattenti del West. Membri di una prestigiosa società, i Soldati cane ricevevano una fascia, quando entravano a far parte del gruppo. Mentre all'inizio si trattava solo di un simbolo di appartenenza, più tardi diventò quello di una volontà incrollabile in combattimento. Questa reputazione originava dall'abitudine dei Soldati cane, durante combattimenti particolarmente brutali, di fissare a terra un piolo per poi legarvisi con la fascia: in tal modo non si sarebbero mossi da quel punto fino alla vittoria o alla morte.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Los guerreros indios conocidos como "soldados perros", flor y nata de los cheyennes, se encontraban entre los más temidos luchadores del oeste americano. Miembros de una prestigiosa sociedad fraternal, recibían una "faja de perro" al ingresar en el grupo. Aunque al principio solo era un emblema que marcaba la pertenencia al grupo, estas "fajas de perro" no tardaron en convertirse en un símbolo de voluntad de hierro. Esta fama derivaba de la práctica de los soldados perros de atarse al suelo con sus fajas y no moverse del sitio hasta conseguir la victoria o caer en el intento.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The term "brave" simply means a Native American warrior. However, the term comes with good reason, as Native American warriors were renowned for their bravery and strong will. Although the braves originally used somewhat primitive weaponry, the Native Americans began to use guns when the Europeans arrived (which they generally traded for with furs, crops, or other things that would help the colonists survive). The Native Americans were also introduced to horses when the Spaniards arrived in the 16th century. The introduction of horses had the largest impact on the Plains Indians, which includes the Sioux. The Plains Indians used horses for trading, hunting, and raiding, among other things.

[TAB]A Missionary is a member of a religious group sent into an area to do evangelism or ministries of service, such as education, literacy, social justice, health care and economic development. The word "mission" originates from 1598 when the Jesuits sent members abroad, derived from the Latin missionem (nom. missio), meaning "act of sending" or mittere, meaning "to send". The word was used in light of its biblical usage; in the Latin translation of the Bible, Christ uses the word when sending the disciples to preach in his name. The term is most commonly used for Christian missions, but can be used for any creed or ideology.

[TAB]The Leopard (Panthera pardus) is one of the five "big cats" in the genus Panthera. It is a member of the Felidae family with a wide range in some parts of sub-Saharan Africa, West Asia, the Middle East, South and Southeast Asia to Siberia.[PARAGRAPH:1]Compared to other members of the Felidae, the leopard has relatively short legs and a long body with a large skull. It is similar in appearance to the jaguar, but is smaller and more slightly built. Its fur is marked with rosettes similar to those of the jaguar, but the leopard's rosettes are smaller and more densely packed, and do not usually have central spots as the jaguars do. Both leopards and jaguars that are melanistic are known as black panthers.[PARAGRAPH:1]The species' success in the wild is in part due to its opportunistic hunting behavior, its adaptability to habitats, its ability to run at speeds approaching 58 kilometres per hour (36 mph), its unequaled ability to climb trees even when carrying a heavy carcass, and its notorious ability for stealth. The leopard consumes virtually any animal that it can hunt down and catch. Its habitat ranges from rainforest to desert terrains.[PARAGRAPH:1]It is listed as Near Threatened on the IUCN Red List because it is declining in large parts of its range due to habitat loss and fragmentation, and hunting for trade and pest control. It is regionally extinct in Hong Kong, Singapore, Kuwait, Syria, Libya and Tunisia.

[TAB]An Inquisitor is an official who roots out heresy and apostasy from within the population, often employing the most brutal methods to do so. The Roman Catholic church has conducted a number of Inquisitions in past centuries - perhaps the most famous being the Spanish Inquisition of the fifteenth century, which targeted Muslims and Jews in Spain - but numerous other religions have engaged in similar practices throughout history.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Un Inquisiteur est un responsable religieux qui traque l'hérésie et l'apostasie parmi la population, souvent au moyen de méthodes brutales. L'Eglise catholique a mené nombre d'inquisitions lors des siècles passés. La plus célèbre fut sans doute l'Inquisition espagnole du quinzième siècle, qui prenait pour cible les Musulmans et les Juifs d'Espagne. De nombreuses autres religions se sont engagées dans des pratiques similaires durant l'Histoire.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Ein Inquisitor ist ein offizieller religiöser Beauftragter, der in der Bevölkerung Häresien und Ketzereien ausmerzt und dabei oft äußerst brutal vorgeht. Die Römisch-Katholische Kirche führte in den vergangenen Jahrhunderten mehrere Inquisitionen durch - die vielleicht berühmteste war die Spanische Inquisition im 15. Jahrhundert, die sich gegen Muslime und Juden richtete - doch viele andere Religionen haben im Lauf der Geschichte ähnliche Praktiken verwendet.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Un Inquisitore è un religioso che ha il compito di debellare eresia e apostasia tra la popolazione, spesso impiegando i mezzi più brutali. La chiesa cattolica romana ha condotto una serie di inquisizioni, nei secoli scorsi, la più famosa delle quali è sicuramente quella del quindicesimo secolo, che perseguitò musulmani ed ebrei in Spagna. Ma anche molte altre religioni hanno svolto attività di questo tipo, nel corso della storia.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Un inquisidor es un dignatario religioso que erradica la herejía y la apostasía de la población, para lo que emplea con frecuencia los métodos más brutales. La iglesia católica romana ha realizado varias inquisiciones en los siglos pasados ?siendo quizá la más famosa la inquisición española del s. XV, que se dirigió contra los musulmanes y judíos que se encontraban en España?, pero varias religiones más han llevado a cabo prácticas similares durante la historia.

TEXT.English: [TAB]A Missionary is a member of a religious group sent into an area to do evangelism or ministries of service, such as education, literacy, social justice, health care and economic development. The word "mission" originates from 1598 when the Jesuits sent members abroad, derived from the Latin missionem (nom. missio), meaning "act of sending" or mittere, meaning "to send". The word was used in light of its biblical usage; in the Latin translation of the Bible, Christ uses the word when sending the disciples to preach in his name. The term is most commonly used for Christian missions, but can be used for any creed or ideology.

[TAB]Two developments in the 19th century made early firearms (such as the musket) obsolete. The first was the invention of a spiral groove, or "rifling," inside the barrel of a gun. Second was the development of the repeating rifle, which could fire multiple shots before it required reloading. The rifle was a better weapon than its ancestors, with much more accuracy over a greater range than the musket and a much higher rate of fire.[PARAGRAPH:1]Riflemen were first employed in large numbers during the American Civil War. The rifle gave a strong defensive advantage, since riflemen could fire several times while the attackers advanced to within hand-to-hand distance. This was normally enough to hold any position. Riflemen dominated the battlefield until the appearance of armored attack vehicles.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Deux inventions du XIXe siècle ont rendu obsolètes les anciennes armes à feu, comme le mousquet. La première est celle des rayures en spirale, gravées à l'intérieur du canon du fusil. L'autre est celle du fusil à répétition, qui permet de tirer plusieurs fois avant qu'il soit nécessaire de recharger. Le fusil est une bien meilleure arme que ses prédécesseurs. Il offre une meilleure précision à longue portée que le mousquet et sa cadence de tir est très supérieure.[PARAGRAPH:1]Les premières grosses formations de fusiliers sont apparues au cours de la Guerre Civile américaine. Le fusil conférait un gros avantage en défense. En effet, le fusilier pouvait tirer plusieurs fois avant que l'attaquant soit suffisamment proche pour engager le combat au corps à corps, ce qui suffisait souvent à tenir la position. Les fusiliers dominèrent les champs de bataille jusqu'à l'apparition des véhicules blindés.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Zwei technologische Neuerungen des 19. Jahrhunderts führten dazu, dass die frühen Schusswaffen (wie beispielsweise die Muskete) schnell als veraltet galten: Zum einen war dies eine Spiralrille bzw. ein "Drall" im Lauf des Gewehrs und zum anderen das Repetiergewehr, mit dem mehrere Schüsse hintereinander abgegeben werden konnten, ohne dass nachgeladen werden musste. Im Vergleich zu seinen Vorläufermodellen bot das Gewehr spürbare Vorteile, so zum Beispiel eine höhere Zielgenauigkeit, eine größere Reichweite als die Muskete und eine höhere Schussfrequenz.[PARAGRAPH:1]Ausschließlich aus Gewehrschützen bestehende Truppenverbände traten erstmals während des Amerikanischen Bürgerkrieges in Aktion. Das Repetiergewehr, mit dem mehrere Schüsse auf vorrückende Angreifer abgegeben werden konnten, verschaffte ihnen einen enormen Defensivvorteil, so dass sie in der Regel jede Stellung halten konnten. Erst mit der Erfindung der gepanzerten Angriffsfahrzeuge endete ihre Vormachtstellung auf dem Schlachtfeld.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Due invenzioni del XIX secolo contribuirono a rendere obsolete le prime armi da fuoco, come il moschetto: la prima fu l'impiego di un solco elicoidale, detto "rigatura", all'interno della canna, la seconda fu il fucile a ripetizione, che consentiva di sparare più colpi prima di dover ricaricare. Quest'arma era più efficace dei suoi antenati, molto più precisa e con una portata maggiore rispetto al moschetto. I fucilieri furono impiegati in gran numero per la prima volta durante la Guerra Civile Americana. La nuova arma assicurava un forte vantaggio difensivo, dal momento che i fucilieri potevano sparare più volte durante l'avanzata del nemico e ciò era sufficiente per mantenere a lungo qualunque posizione. La supremazia dei fucilieri non fu oscurata fino all'avvento dei veicoli d'assalto corazzati.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Dos avances del siglo XIX dejaron obsoletas las primeras armas de fuego (como, por ejemplo, los mosquetes). El primero fue la invención del surco en espiral, o ánima rayada, en el cañón de las armas de fuego. El segundo fue el rifle de repetición, que podía disparar varias veces antes de que hiciera falta recargarlo. El rifle era un arma superior a sus predecesoras, dotado de mucha mayor precisión a largas distancias y una cadencia de fuego muy superior a la del mosquete.[PARAGRAPH:1]La primera vez que se utilizaron fusileros en gran número fue en la Guerra de Secesión. El fusil proporcionaba una gran ventaja al defensor, puesto que los fusileros podían disparar varias veces antes de que el enemigo consiguiera alcanzar sus posiciones. Normalmente, con esto bastaba para defender cualquier posición. Los fusileros dominaron los campos de batalla hasta la aparición de los vehículos blindados de ataque.

TEXT.English: [TAB](Wikipedia) A wa'a kaulua is a Polynesian double-hulled voyaging canoe.

[TAB]Daoshi refers to a priest in Taoism. According to legend, these Taoist recluses would practice alchemy and austerity in the mountains, with the aim of becoming xian, or immortal beings. The activities of the daoshi tend to be informed by materials which may be found in the Daozang, or Taoist canon; however, daoshi generally choose, or inherit, specific texts which have been passed down for generations from teacher to student, rather than consulting published versions of these works. Daoshi practices can include various ceremonies, including fortune telling.[PARAGRAPH:1]Today there are two dominant priesthoods. The Quanzhen School, which is dominant in the northern half of the People's Republic of China, have priests that resemble Buddhist monks in that they are celibate, vegetarian, and live in temples. One of the most renowned locations is the White Cloud Temple in Beijing.[PARAGRAPH:1]The other main priesthood is the Zhengyi Tao, in which the priests can marry, eat meat, and live in their own homes. They are mostly priests part-time and can hold other jobs. They are present all over China, although with different names according to the local lineages. For example, in northern China there are the yinyang masters of the Lingbao sub-tradition.

[TAB]A submarine is a submersible warship, designed to attack enemy vessels while remaining hidden underwater. Although defensively weak, submarines are feared because of their ability to make a stealthy approach and attack without warning. Often, the presence of a submarine is not detected until the first of the sub's torpedoes strikes its target. The Germans first used submarine warfare extensively during World War I.[PARAGRAPH:1]Developments after the war, such as sonar, made the submarine even more effective. During World War II, submarines were used extensively by all the world's naval powers. Today's submarines, in addition to their role as fast attack vessels, also carry nuclear weapons that can be fired from underwater positions just off the coast of an enemy country.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Un sous-marin est un navire de guerre submersible, conçu pour attaquer les bateaux ennemis tout en restant caché sous l'eau. Bien que peu équipés pour la défense, les sous-marins sont redoutés pour leur capacité à effectuer une approche discrète et à attaquer sans prévenir. Leur présence n'est souvent détectée que lorsqu'ils ont tiré leur première torpille. Ce sont les Allemands qui ont les premiers mené une guerre sous-marine intensive au cours de la Première Guerre mondiale.[PARAGRAPH:1]Après la guerre, un certain nombre d'inventions, comme le sonar, ont amélioré l'efficacité des sous-marins. Au cours de la Deuxième Guerre mondiale, toutes les puissances navales les ont utilisés massivement. Les sous-marins contemporains, outre leur rôle de navires d'attaque rapides, transportent des armes nucléaires qu'ils peuvent tirer sans faire surface à proximité des côtes ennemies.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Ein Unterseeboot ist ein tauchfähiges Kriegsschiff, das sich unbemerkt an feindliche Seefahrzeuge annähern und diese dann aus dem Schutz der Tiefe heraus unerwartet angreifen kann. Zwar besitzen U-Boote selbst keine allzu guten Verteidigungssysteme, dennoch haben sie das Überraschungsmoment ganz auf ihrer Seite und sind gerade deswegen so gefürchtet: Häufig bleibt die Anwesenheit eines Unterseebootes völlig unentdeckt, bis die ersten Torpedos auf ihr Ziel treffen. Die Deutschen setzten als erste Streitmacht während des 1. Weltkrieges umfassend U-Boote ein.[PARAGRAPH:1]Nach dem Krieg wurde die Effizienz der U-Boote durch technische Neuerungen wie das Sonar weiter gesteigert, und im 2. Weltkrieg unterhielten bereits alle Seemächte der Welt U-Boot-Flotten. Neben ihrer Funktion als schnelle und wendige Angriffseinheiten sind moderne Unterseeboote mittlerweile auch mit Atomwaffen ausgerüstet, die gegebenenfalls aus unterseeischen Stellungen in der Nähe feindlicher Küstengebiete abgeschossen werden können.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Un sottomarino è un natante in grado di rimanere immerso e quindi di attaccare le navi nemiche senza essere avvistato. Nonstante la sua debolezza in ambito difensivo, si tratta di un temibile avversario per la sua capacità di attaccare senza essere individuato visivamente; spesso infatti la presenza di un sottomarino non viene rilevata fino al momento dell'attacco.[PARAGRAPH:1]I primi sottomarini furono utilizzati dai Tedeschi durante la Prima Guerra Mondiale e già nel secondo conflitto lo sviluppo tecnologico e l'efficacia del mezzo lo portarono a essere utilizzato da tutti gli eserciti del mondo. Oggi esistono sommergibili nucleari in grado di lanciare missili atomici in prossimità delle coste del paese scelto come obiettivo.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El submarino es un barco de guerra sumergible, ideado para atacar a barcos enemigos sin necesidad de emerger. Aunque desde el punto de vista defensivo son muy débiles, los submarinos son temibles a causa de su capacidad para acercarse sigilosamente y atacar sin previo aviso. A menudo, la presencia de un submarino no se detecta hasta que el primero de sus torpedos hace blanco. Los alemanes fueron los pioneros en el uso generalizado de los submarinos, durante la Primera Guerra Mundial.[PARAGRAPH:1]Ciertos descubrimientos posteriores a la guerra, como por ejemplo el sonar, aumentaron más la efectividad de los submarinos. En la Segunda Guerra Mundial, todas las potencias navales del mundo los emplearon exhaustivamente. Los submarinos modernos, además de operar como naves de ataque rápido, transportan cabezas nucleares que pueden disparar contra territorio enemigo sin necesidad de emerger.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Espionage or, casually, spying involves a government, company/firm or individual obtaining information considered secret or confidential without the permission of the holder of the information. Espionage is inherently clandestine, as it is taken for granted that it is unwelcome and in many cases illegal and punishable by law. It is a subset of "intelligence gathering", which otherwise may be conducted from public sources and using perfectly legal and ethical means. It is crucial to distinguish espionage from "intelligence" gathering, as the latter does not necessarily involve espionage, but often collates open-source information.[PARAGRAPH:1]Espionage is often part of an institutional effort by a government or commercial concern. However, the term is generally associated with state spying on potential or actual enemies primarily for military purposes. Spying involving corporations is known as industrial espionage.[PARAGRAPH:1]One of the most effective ways to gather data and information about the enemy (or potential enemy) is by infiltrating the enemy's ranks. This is the job of the spy (espionage agent). Spies can bring back all sorts of information concerning the size and strength of an enemy army. They can also find dissidents within the enemy's forces and influence them to defect. In times of crisis, spies can also be used to steal technology and to sabotage the enemy in various ways. Counterintelligence operatives can feed false information to enemy spies, protecting important domestic secrets, and preventing attempts at subversion. Nearly every country has very strict laws concerning espionage, and the penalty for being caught is often severe. However, the benefits that can be gained through espionage are generally great enough that most governments and many large corporations make use of it to varying degrees.

[TAB]Concurrent with the development of a stealth fighter, aeronautical engineers began to apply stealth technology to a full-scale bomber. The B-1B bomber, which went into service in 1986 as a replacement for the B-52, incorporated some of these innovations. The radar signature of the B-1B was reduced to a mere one percent that of the B-52 due to its low cross-section and its minimal use of radar-reflective, hard-edged surfaces.[PARAGRAPH:1]Soon after the B-1B entered service, the U.S. Air Force commissioned Northrop to develop a true stealth bomber as an eventual replacement. First revealed to the public in 1988, the B-2 stealth bomber uses a flying wing design similar in shape to the F-117A stealth fighter. The flying wing design reduces the profile of the B-2 by incorporating its engines into the body of the plane. The engine exhausts and intakes are shielded to prevent infrared tracking. The B-2 also makes use of curved surfaces and radar-absorbing materials to enhance its "invisibility", and make it far less detectable than the B-1B. As of the late 1980s, it was announced that 132 B-2's would be constructed, and would enter service sometime in the 1990s.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Parallèlement au développement d'un chasseur furtif, les ingénieurs aéronautiques commencèrent à appliquer les technologies furtives à un bombardier. Le B-1B, entré en service en 1986 en remplacement du B-52, contenait certaines de ces technologies. Grâce à sa coupe basse et à la réduction des surfaces réfléchissantes, la taille de la signature radar d'un B-1B était cent fois moindre que celle d'un B-52.[PARAGRAPH:1]Peu après la mise en service du B-1B, la U.S. Air Force chargea Northrop de la mise au point d'un véritable bombardier furtif. Dévoilé au public en 1988, le bombardier furtif B-2 est une aile volante, sur le modèle du chasseur furtif F-117A. Le concept d'aile volante permet de rendre plus compacte la silhouette de l'avion en incorporant les moteurs dans le corps de l'appareil. Les prises d'air et les échappements des moteurs sont profilés pour réduire la signature infrarouge. Le B-2 utilise aussi des surfaces incurvées et des matériaux ne réfléchissant pas les ondes radars, ce qui permet d'améliorer sa "furtivité" et de le rendre beaucoup plus difficile à détecter que le B-1B. A la fin des années 1980s, il a été annoncé que 132 B-2 serait construits et qu'ils entreraient en service dans les années 1990.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Gleichzeitig mit der Entwicklung des Stealth-Jagdflugzeugs begannen Luftfahrtingenieure, die Stealth-Technologie auf einen herkömmlichen Bomber zu übertragen. Der B-1B-Bomber, der im Jahre 1986 an die Stelle des B-52 trat, nutzte bereits einige der daraus resultierenden Neuerungen. So konnte beispielsweise die Radarkennung des B-1B aufgrund seines geringen Querschnitts und der minimalen Verwendung radarreflektierender hartkantiger Oberflächen auf lediglich 1 Prozent des B-52 reduziert werden.[PARAGRAPH:1]Kurz nachdem der B-1B-Bomber in Dienst gestellt wurde, beauftragte die amerikanische Luftwaffe die Firma Northrop mit der Entwicklung eines echten Stealth-Bombers, der den B-1B ablösen sollte. Das Flügeldesign des B-2-Stealth-Bombers, der im Jahre 1988 erstmals der Öffentlichkeit präsentiert wurde, ähnelt der Flügelgestaltung des F-117A-Stealth-Kampfflugzeugs, wobei das Profil des B-2 durch die Unterbringung der Motoren im Flugkörper reduziert wird. Die Ansaugturbinen und die Abgasanlage des Motors sind abgeschirmt, um Ortung durch Infrarottechnologie zu verhindern. Darüber hinaus kommen beim B-2 auch gekrümmte Oberflächen und radarabsorbierende Materialien zum Einsatz, wodurch sich seine "Unsichtbarkeit" im Vergleich zum B-1B deutlich erhöht. Ende der 80er Jahre wurde bekannt gegeben, dass insgesamt 132 Exemplare des B-2-Stealth-Bombers gebaut und im Laufe der 90er Jahre in Betrieb genommen werden sollten.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Gli ingegneri aeronautici hanno sviluppato contemporaneamente le applicazioni della tecnologia stealth destinate a caccia e bombardieri. Il B-1B, entrato in servizio nel 1986 in sostituzione del B-52, incorpora alcune di queste innovazioni. La rilevabilità radar del B-1B è ridotta all'1%% rispetto a quella dei normali aerei, grazie al design particolare e all'utilizzo di superfici non radar-riflettenti.[PARAGRAPH:1]Dopo l'entrata in servizio di questo aereo, l'aeronautica degli Stati Uniti d'America ha ordinato alla Northrop lo sviluppo di un bombardiere completamente invisibile. Venne così costruito il B-2, presentato ufficialmente nel 1988, che ricorda nella forma il caccia F-117A Stealth. I motori dell'aereo sono incorporati nella fusoliera e gli scarichi sono schermati per evitare le emissioni infrarosse. Anche il B-2 impiega superfici curve e materiali non radar-riflettenti, che contribuiscono a rendere l'aereo invisibile, rendendolo meno rivelabile del B1-B. Verso la fine degli anni '80, venne annunciata la costruzione di 132 B-2, che sarebbero dovuti entrare in uso negli anni '90.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Paralelamente al desarrollo del caza invisible, los ingenieros aeronáuticos comenzaron a aplicar la tecnología de invisibilidad a un bombardero. El bombardero B-1B, que entró en servicio en 1986 en sustitución de los B-52, incorporaba algunos de estos avances. Gracias a su esbeltez y su perfil suavizado, que minimiza la reflexión de las señales de radar, la señal de radar del B-1B era cien veces inferior a la del B-52.[PARAGRAPH:1]Poco después de que el B-1B entrara en servicio, las fuerzas aéreas estadounidenses encargaron a Northrop el desarrollo de un auténtico bombardero invisible como reemplazo futuro. Hecho público en 1988, el bombardero invisible B-2 utiliza un diseño de ala voladora, similar al del caza invisible F-117. El diseño de las alas reduce el perfil del B-2 incorporando los motores a la estructura del avión. Las toberas de los motores y las entradas de aire están cubiertas, con el fin de confundir a las señales infrarrojas. El B-2 también utiliza superficies curvas y materiales que absorben las señales de los radares para aumentar su "invisibilidad", lo que lo hace incluso más difícil de detectar que el B-1B. A finales de la década de los 80, se anunció que se construirían 132 B-2, que serían incorporados al servicio a lo largo de la década siguiente.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Slaves were depended workers, which were used in the ancient world. Slaves were treated like property and were mostly prisoners of war or childrens of slaves. Slaves were used mostly in civil engineering and in the mines, which was one of the most dangerous work in the ancient world.

[TAB]A mobad is a Zoroastrian cleric of a particular rank. Unlike a herbad (ervad), a mobed is qualified to serve as celebrant priest at the Yasna ceremony. A mobed is also qualified to train other priests.[PARAGRAPH:1]In general (lay) use, the term is also used as an honorific to denote any priest, of any rank. For instance, Hormizd I appointed Kartir moabadan-moabad, which is frequently translated as 'priest of priests', but more precisely indicates 'high priest of high priests'.[PARAGRAPH:1]Zoroastrian priests in India are required to be male, but women have been ordained in Iran and North America as a mobedyar, meaning a women mobed.

[TAB]The Zulu spearmen were warriors without peer in southern Africa, dispatching every force that they encountered until running up against the superior technology of the Europeans. The Zulus were organized for the first time by Shaka, who began forming spearmen into groups called "impi" even before he became the chief of his tribe. Impi warriors began training as early as the age of six, serving first as porters and servants, and when of age, the cadets were trained in the use of weapons. When Zulu males reached adulthood at age twenty, they would become full members of their warband.[PARAGRAPH:1]Zulu spearmen were expected to be able to outrun a horse, travel 50 miles a day on foot, and move silently through rough terrain. The difficult training that the Zulu warriors went through made them tougher and stronger than their opponents, who frequently outnumbered the Zulus in battle.[PARAGRAPH:1]When going into battle, the Zulu spearmen painted their faces with chalk and red ochre to make themselves more intimidating. They carried spears (called "ilkwa") made of wood with a long iron point. The ilkwa was a stabbing weapon, unlike its predecessor the javelin-like "assegai," which had been used for throwing. Along with the spear, Zulus would carry a medium-sized shield. As contact with Europeans became more frequent later in the nineteenth century, Zulu warriors also made use of muskets and rifles captured from the British, although the Zulus did not have the training to use them properly.[PARAGRAPH:1]Tactically, the soldiers of a Zulu impi often used Shaka's "bull horns" formation, which consisted a main force ("isifuba" or chest) and two wings on the sides ("izimpondo" or horns) designed to outflank the enemy. A fourth group of veterans would remain as a reserve in the rear.[PARAGRAPH:1]The Zulu spearmen formed an effective and highly-versatile army which proved to be almost invincible when facing other African forces. They traveled lightly and could move very fast (if not the 50 miles a day that they claimed), but they also packed enough force to disrupt heavy enemy formations. Shaka used hit-and-run techniques against the numerically-superior Ndwandwe in the 1820s and achieved complete victory in a series of engagements.[PARAGRAPH:1]However, the Zulu spearmen were no match for the Martini-Henry rifles and Maxim guns of the British army when they went to war in 1878. The technological rift could not be overcome with Zulu valor.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Les porte-lances zoulous sont des guerriers hors pair du Sud de l'Afrique, qui l'emportent contre toutes les forces qu'ils rencontrent jusqu'à ce qu'ils soient confrontés à la technologie supérieure des Européens. Les Zoulous sont organisés pour la première fois par Chaka, qui commence à regrouper les porte-lances dans des groupes appelés "impis" avant même qu'il ne devienne le chef de cette tribu. Les guerriers impis commencent leur formation dès l'âge de six ans, servant d'abord de porteurs et de serviteurs. Devenus majeurs, les cadets s'entraînent à manier les armes. Lorsque les hommes zoulous atteignent l'âge adulte, à vingt ans, ils deviennent membres à part entière de leur groupe guerrier.[PARAGRAPH:1] Les porte-lances zoulous doivent être capables de dépasser un cheval, de marcher 80 km par jour et de se déplacer en silence sur des terrains escarpés. Le difficile entraînement auquel sont soumis les guerriers zoulous les rend plus résistants et plus forts que leurs ennemis, qui sont généralement plus nombreux que les Zoulous dans les batailles.[PARAGRAPH:1]Lorsqu'ils partent aux combats, les porte-lances zoulous se peignent le visage avec de la craie ou de l'ocre rouge pour être plus intimidants. Ils portent des lances de bois avec une longue pointe en fer, appelées "ilkwas". La ilkwa est une arme coupante, contrairement à l'arme qu'elle remplace, la "assegai", qui ressemblait à un javelot et devait être lancée. Outre la lance, les Zoulous portent un bouclier de moyenne taille. Au XIXe siècle, lorsqu'ils entrent plus souvent en contact avec les Européens, les guerriers zoulous utilisent également des mousquets et des fusils pris aux Britanniques, même s'ils ne savent pas les utiliser correctement.[PARAGRAPH:1]Sur le plan tactique, les soldats d'un impi zoulou utilisent souvent la formation en "tête de buffle", qui consiste en une force principale ("isifuba" ou poitrine) et deux ailes sur les côtés ("izimpondo" ou cornes) qui servent à déborder l'ennemi. Un quatrième groupe de vétérans reste en réserve à l'arrière.[PARAGRAPH:1] Les porte-lances zoulous forment une armée efficace et pleine de ressources qui se révèle presque invincible face aux autres forces africaines. Ils se déplacent avec peu d'équipement et peuvent avancer très vite, même s'ils ne font par les 80 km qu'ils prétendent parcourir. Ils disposent par ailleurs de forces suffisantes pour vaincre d'importantes formations ennemies. Dans les années 1820, Chaka utilise des techniques éclair contre les Ndwandwes, numériquement supérieurs, et parvient à remporter une victoire totale dans plusieurs combats.[PARAGRAPH:1]Cependant, les porte-lances zoulous sont trop faibles face aux fusils Martini-Henry et aux mitrailleuses Maxim de l'armée britannique, lorsqu'ils entrent en guerre en 1878. Le fossé technologique ne peut pas être comblé par la bravoure des Zoulous.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Die Speerkämpfer der Zulu waren die mit Abstand besten Krieger Südafrikas und schlugen bis zur Entwicklung überlegener Technologien durch die Europäer jede Streitmacht nieder, der sie begegneten. Die ersten Schritte in Richtung Kampfordnung erfuhren die Zulu durch ihren späteren Stammesführer Shaka, der die Speerwerfer in "Impi" genannte Regimenter ordnete. Die Ausbildung eines Impi-Kriegers begann im zarten Alter von sechs Jahren, wobei sie zunächst als Träger und dann als Diener eingesetzt wurden und erst, wenn sie alt genug waren, den Umgang mit Waffen erlernten. Sobald ein männlicher Zulu 20 Jahre alt wurde und damit als Erwachsener galt, wurde er als vollwertiges Mitglied in den Kampfverbund aufgenommen.[PARAGRAPH:1]Von den Speerkämpfern der Zulu wurde erwartet, dass sie ein Pferd ein- oder überholen, etwa 80 Kilometer pro Tag zu Fuß zurücklegen und sich auch auf rauem Gelände sehr leise fortbewegen konnten. Die schwierige Ausbildung, die ein Zulu-Krieger durchlaufen musste, härtete ihn zusehends ab und machte ihn stärker als seine Gegner, die den Zulu im Kampf häufig zahlenmäßig überlegen waren.[PARAGRAPH:1]Wenn sie ins Gefecht zogen, bemalten die Speerkämpfer der Zulu ihre Gesichter mit Kreide und Ockerfarbe, um noch Furcht einflößender zu wirken. Statt mit den früher verwendeten Wurfspießen (den "Assegai") waren die Krieger seit der von Shaka eingeführten militärischen Neuerungen nun mit Stoßspeeren (den so genannten "Iklwa") ausgestattet, die aus Holz gefertigt waren und eine lange eiserne Spitze besaßen. Außerdem führten sie mittelgroße Schilde bei sich. Als es im 19. Jahrhundert immer häufiger zu kriegerischen Auseinandersetzungen mit den Europäern kam, setzten die Zulu-Krieger auch die von den Briten erbeuteten Musketen und Gewehre ein, obwohl sie keinerlei Ausbildung im Umgang mit derartigen Waffen hatten.[PARAGRAPH:1]Taktisch wurden die Zulu-Krieger des Impi oftmals in Shakas "Büffelhorn"-Formation eingesetzt, die aus einer Hauptkampftruppe (den "Isifuba", zu Deutsch etwa Brustkorb) und zwei Flügeltruppen an den Flanken (den "Izimpondo", zu Deutsch etwa Hörner) bestand, wobei Letztere den Feind umzingeln sollten. Und schließlich bildete eine vierte Veteranentruppe an der Rückseite die Reserve.[PARAGRAPH:1]Die Speerkämpfer der Zulu stellten eine effiziente und höchst flexible Armee dar, die sich in Begegnungen mit anderen afrikanischen Streitmächten als nahezu unbesiegbar erwies. Sie waren nur leicht ausgerüstet und konnten sich sehr schnell fortbewegen (wenn auch nicht unbedingt immer die besagten 80 Kilometer am Tag), aber sie hatten stets genug Kraft, um selbst schwere feindliche Formationen auseinander sprengen zu können. Im Kampf gegen die zahlenmäßig überlegenen Truppen der Ndwandwe um 1820 wendete Shaka die "Hit and Run"-Taktik an und trug so in mehreren Gefechten den Gesamtsieg davon.[PARAGRAPH:1]Gegen die Martini-Henry-Gewehre und Maxim-Maschinengewehre, welche die britische Armee im Krieg von 1878 einsetzte, konnten die Speerkämpfer der Zulu allerdings nichts ausrichten - die technologische Kluft zwischen den beiden Kriegsparteien ließ sich auch durch die Tapferkeit der Zulu nicht überbrücken.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]I lancieri zulu furono guerrieri senza pari nell'Africa meridionale, capaci di sconfiggere ogni avversario finché non si scontrarono con la superiorità tecnologica degli europei. Gli Zulu furono organizzati per la prima volta da Shaka, che cominciò a ordinare i lancieri in gruppi detti "impi" prima ancora di diventare il capo della sua tribù. I guerrieri impi iniziavano l'addestramento a sei anni, facendo prima da ausiliari e servitori ai soldati e poi, una volta diventati maturi, venendo addestrati all'uso delle armi. I maschi zulu raggiungevano la maggiore età a venti anni e solo allora diventavano membri della tribù a pieno titolo.[PARAGRAPH:1]Dai lancieri zulu si esigeva che sapessero superare un cavallo in corsa, che fossero in grado di percorrere 50 miglia al giorno a piedi e che sapessero spostarsi silenziosamente su terreni aspri. Il rigoroso addestramento rendeva i guerrieri zulu più resistenti e più forti dei nemici, che spesso superavano di numero i guerrieri zulu.[PARAGRAPH:1]Quando andavano in battaglia, i lancieri zulu si dipingevano il volto con gesso e ocra rossa per intimidire il nemico. Essi avevano con sé delle lance corte ("iklwa") fatte di legno con una lunga punta metallica. L'iklwa serviva a pugnalare e non a essere scagliata, a differenza del suo predecessore ("assegai") che era simile a un giavellotto. Oltre alla lancia, gli Zulu avevano uno scudo di medie dimensioni. Quando i contatti con gli europei diventarono più frequenti, i guerrieri zulu utilizzarono anche i moschetti e i fucili sottratti ai Britannici, anche se nessuno mai insegnò loro a utilizzarli in modo efficiente.[PARAGRAPH:1]Dal punto di vista tattico, un impi adottava spesso la formazione a "corna di bufalo", che era composta da un corpo centrale ("isifuba" o torso) e da due ali ai lati ("izimpondo" o corna) che dovevano aggirare il nemico. In retroguardia restava un gruppo di veterani come riserva.[PARAGRAPH:1]I lancieri zulu formavano un corpo molto efficiente e versatile e praticamente invincibile se opposto agli altri eserciti africani. Essi viaggiavano leggeri e veloci (anche se forse non raggiungevano le 50 miglia al giorno), ma un impi era abbastanza potente da scombussolare formazioni nemiche pesanti. Intorno al 1820 Shaka usò la tecnica del mordi e fuggi contro i più numerosi Ndwandwe e ottenne una vittoria completa dopo una serie di scontri.[PARAGRAPH:1]Tuttavia i lancieri zulu non potevano competere con i fucili Martini-Henry o con le pistole Maxim dell'esercito britannico quando le due fazioni si scontrarono nel 1878. Il divario tecnologico era troppo profondo persino per i valorosi Zulu.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Los lanceros zulúes, guerreros sin igual en la zona de África del sur, derrotaron a todos los que se enfrentaron hasta topar con la superior tecnología de los europeos. Los zulúes fueron organizados por primera vez por Chaka, quien empezó a formarlos en unidades llamadas "impi" incluso antes de llegar a ser jefe de su tribu. Los guerreros impi empezaban a entrenarse a los seis años. Primero servían como porteadores y criados y, cuando llegaban a la edad necesaria, eran instruidos en el uso de las armas. Cuando los zulúes llegaban a la mayoría de edad (a los veinte años) se convertían en miembros de pleno derecho de sus unidades.[PARAGRAPH:1]Los lanceros zulúes debían ser capaces de correr más que un caballo, recorrer ochenta kilómetros al día a pie y viajar por terreno abrupto. Las dificultades que afrontaban durante su instrucción los hacían más duros y fuertes que sus adversarios, que muchas veces los superaban en número en el campo de batalla.[PARAGRAPH:1]Antes de las batallas, los lanceros zulúes se pintaban la cara de teja y ocre para parecer más amenazadores. Iban armados con lanzas (llamadas "ilkwas") de madera con una alargada punta de hierro. La ilkwa era un arma punzante de cuerpo a cuerpo, a diferencia de su predecesora, la "assegai" que era una especie de jabalina utilizada como arma arrojadiza. Junto con esta lanza, los zulúes llevaban un escudo de tamaño medio. A lo largo del siglo XIX, a medida que aumentaba su contacto con los europeos, los guerreros zulúes empezaron a hacer uso de los mosquetes y rifles capturados a los británicos, pero siempre carecieron de la instrucción necesaria para utilizarlos bien.[PARAGRAPH:1]Desde el punto de vista táctico, los soldados de los impis zulúes empleaban a menudo la formación de "los cuernos del búfalo", que consistía en un contingente principal ("isifuba" o pecho) y dos alas ("izimpondo" o cuernos), cuya tarea era envolver al enemigo. A veces, un cuarto grupo de veteranos permanecía en retaguardia como reserva.[PARAGRAPH:1]Los lanceros zulúes formaban un ejército eficaz y muy versátil que era casi invencible cuando se enfrentaba a otras fuerzas africanas. Viajaban con poca impedimenta y podían moverse muy deprisa (aunque puede que no tanto como los ochenta kilómetros que ellos decían) y, además, tenían la fuerza suficiente como para desbaratar formaciones pesadas enemigas. En la década de 1820, Chaka usó una táctica de incursiones y maniobras rápidas contra los ndwandwe, superiores en número, y alcanzó una victoria total tras una serie de batallas.[PARAGRAPH:1]Sin embargo, los lanceros zulúes no eran rival para los rifles Martini-Henry y las ametralladoras Maxim del ejército británico cuando se inició la guerra (1878). La bravura zulú no podía llenar el abismo de la diferencia tecnológica.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The gray wolf (Canis lupus), also known as the timber wolf, true wolf or western wolf is a canid native to the wilderness and remote areas of North America, Eurasia, and North Africa. It is the largest extant member of its family, with males averaging 43-45 kg (95-99 lb), and females 36-38.5 kg (79-85 lb). Like the red wolf, it is distinguished from other Canis species by its larger size and less pointed features, particularly on the ears and muzzle. Its winter fur is long and bushy, and predominantly a mottled gray in color, although nearly pure white, red, or brown to black also occur.[PARAGRAPH:1]The gray wolf is the most specialised member of the genus Canis, as demonstrated by its morphological adaptations to hunting large prey, its more gregarious nature, and its highly advanced expressive behavior. It is nonetheless closely related enough to smaller Canis species, such as the eastern wolf, coyote and golden jackal to produce fertile hybrids. It is the only species of Canis to have a range encompassing both the Old and New Worlds, and originated in Eurasia during the Pleistocene, colonizing North America on at least three separate occasions during the Rancholabrean. It is a social animal, travelling in nuclear families consisting of a mated pair, accompanied by the pair's adult offspring. The gray wolf is typically an apex predator throughout its range, with only humans and tigers posing a serious threat to it. It feeds primarily on large ungulates, though it also eats smaller animals, livestock, carrion, and garbage.[PARAGRAPH:1]The gray wolf is one of the world's best known and well researched animals, with probably more books written about it than any other wildlife species. It has a long history of association with humans, having been despised and hunted in most pastoral communities due to its attacks on livestock, while conversely being respected in some agrarian and hunter-gatherer societies. It is the sole ancestor of the dog, which genetic and paleontological records indicate was first domesticated in Europe 18,800-32,100 years ago by hunter-gatherers. Although the fear of wolves is pervasive in many human societies, the majority of recorded attacks on people have been attributed to animals suffering from rabies. Non-rabid wolves have attacked and killed people, mainly children, but this is unusual, as wolves are relatively few, live away from people, and have been taught to fear humans by hunters and shepherds.[PARAGRAPH:1]The gray wolf was once one of the world's most widely distributed mammals, living throughout the northern hemisphere north of 15°N latitude in North America and 12°N in India. However, deliberate human persecution has reduced the species' range to about one third, due to livestock predation and fear over attacks on humans. The species is now extinct in much of Western Europe, in Mexico and much of the USA. In modern times, the gray wolf occurs mostly in wilderness and remote areas, particularly in Canada, Alaska and northern USA, Europe, and Asia from about 75°N to 12°N. Wolf population declines have been arrested since the 1970s, and have fostered recolonization and reintroduction in parts of its former range, due to legal protection, changes in land-use and rural human population shifts to cities. Competition with humans for livestock and game species, concerns over the danger posed by wolves to people, and habitat fragmentation pose a continued threat to the species. Despite these threats, because of the gray wolf's relatively widespread range and stable population, it is classified as Least Concern by the IUCN.

[TAB]The history of coffee begins in the 9th century. It is thought to have originated in the highlands of Ethiopia and spread to the rest of the world via Egypt and Europe. The word coffee is derived from the Arabic word Qah'wa, over Ottoman Turkish Kahve, which originally meant wine or other intoxicating liquors. Partly due to the Islamic prohibition on drinking alcohol, preparing and drinking coffee became an important social ritual. In the 15th century, Muslims introduced coffee in Persia, Egypt, northern Africa and Turkey, where the first cafeteria, Kiva Han, opened in 1475 in Constantinople. The stimulant effect of drinking coffee caused it to be forbidden among orthodox and conservative imams in Mecca in 1511 and in Cairo in 1532 by a theological court. In Egypt, coffeehouses and warehouses containing coffee cherries were sacked. But the product's popularity, particularly among intellectuals, led to the reversal of this decision in 1524 by an order of the Ottoman Turkish Sultan Selim I. From the Muslim world, coffee spread to Europe, where it became popular in the 17th century. Dutch traders were the first to start large scale import of coffee into Europe.
TEXT.French: [TAB]L'histoire de café commence dans le neuvième siècle. Il est pensé avoir provenu dans les pays de montagne d'Ethiopie et de diffusion au reste du monde via l'Egypte et d'Europe. Le café de mot est dérivé du Qah'wa de mot arabe, par-dessus Kahve turc ottoman, qui a signifié au début le vin ou l'autres enivrer alcools. Partiellement en raison de la prohibition islamique sur boire d'alcool, préparant et boire le café est devenu un rite social important. Dans le 15e siècle, Musulmans ont introduit le café dans Perse, l'Egypte, Afrique et Turquie septentrionaux, où le premier cafétéria, Kiva Han, ouvert dans 1475 dans Constantinople. L'effet de stimulant de boire de café a causé l'être défendu parmi imams orthodoxe et conservateur dans Mecque dans 1511 et dans Caire dans 1532 par un tribunal théologique. Dans l'Egypte, les cafés et les entrepôts contenant les cerises de café ont été sacked. Mais la popularité du produit, particulièrement parmi les intellectuels, mené au renversement de cette décision dans 1524 par un ordre du Sultan Selim I. turc ottoman. Du monde Musulman, la diffusion de café à Europe, où il est devenu populaire dans le 17e siècle. Les commerçants hollandais étaient le premier commencer la grande importation à l'échelle de café dans Europe.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Die Geschichte des Kaffees beginnt im 9. Jahrhundert. Es ist gedacht, in den Hochländern von Äthiopien und Ausbreitung zur restlichen Welt über Ägypten und Europa hervorgebracht zu haben. Der Wortkaffee ist vom arabischen Wort Qah'wa, über Ottoman türkischem Kahve abgeleitet, der ursprünglich Wein oder andere Berauschenalkohole bedeutet hat. Teilweise auf Grund des islamischen Verbots auf Trinkenalkohol, der und Trinkenkaffee vorbereitet, ist geworden ein wichtiges soziales Ritual. Im 15. Jahrhundert haben Muslime Kaffee in Persien, Ägypten, nördlichen Afrika und die Türkei, eingeführt wo die erste Cafeteria, Kiva Han, geöffnet in 1475 in Constantinople. Die Anregungswirkung, Kaffee zu trinken, hat verursacht, dass es unter orthodoxem und konservativem imams in Mekka in 1511 und in Kairo in 1532 durch einen theologischen Gerichtshof verboten wird. In Ägypten wurden coffeehouses und Lagerhäuser, die Kaffeekirschen enthalten, rausgeschmissen. Aber die Popularität hat des Produkts, besonders unter Intellektuelle, zur Umkehrung von dieser Entscheidung in 1524 durch einen Reihenfolge den Ottoman türkischen Sultan Selim I. geführt. Von der Muslimisch Welt Kaffeeausbreitung nach Europa, wo es populär im 17. Jahrhundert geworden ist. Holländische Händler waren das erste, Großmaßstabimport des Kaffees in Europa anzufangen.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]La storia di caffè inizia nel secolo 9. È pensato avere provenuto nella regione montuosa di Etiopia e nella coperta al riposo del mondo via Egitto ed in Europa. Il caffè di parola è derivato dal Qah'wa di parola Arabo, sopra Kahve Ottomano turco, che ha significato originalmente il vino o l'altro inebria i liquori. In parte dovuto alla proibizione Islamica su bere di alcool, preparando ed il caffè di bere è diventato un rituale importante sociale. Nel secolo 15, Musulmani hanno introdotto il caffè in Persia, Egitto, Africa del nord ed il Tacchino, dove la prima mensa, Kiva Han, aperto in 1475 in Costantinopoli. L'effetto di stimolante di bere di caffè l'ha causato essere vietato fra fra l'imams ortodosso e conservatore in Mecca in 1511 ed in Cairo in 1532 da un tribunale teologico. In Egitto, i caffè ed i magazzini contenendo le ciliegie di caffè sono stato sacked. Ma la popolarità del prodotto, particolarmente fra gli intellettuali, condotti all'inversione di questa decisione in 1524 da un ordine del Selim di Sultano Ottomano turco I. Dal mondo Musulmano, la coperta di caffè a Europa, dove è diventato popolare nel secolo 17. I commercianti olandesi erano il primo cominciare l'importazione di larga scala di caffè in Europa.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]La historia de café empieza en el siglo IX. Es pensado haber originado en las tierras altas de Etiopía y la extensión al resto del mundo vía Egipto y Europa. El café de la palabra es derivado de la palabra árabe Qah'wa, sobre Kahve turco otomano, que significó originalmente vino u otro intoxicando los licores. En parte debido a la prohibición Islámica en el alcohol potable, preparando y café potable llegó a ser un ritual social importante. En el siglo XV, los musulmanes introdujeron café en Persia, Egipto, Africa septentrionales y Turquía, donde el primer restaurante, Kiva Han, abrió en 1475 en Constantinopla. El efecto de estimulante de café potable causó que estuviera prohibido entre imanes ortodoxos y conservadores en Meca en 1511 y en El Cairo en 1532 por un tribunal teológico. En Egipto, los cafés y los almacenes que contienen cerezas de café fueron ensacados. Pero la popularidad del producto, especialmente entre intelectuales, llevó a la reversión de esta decisión en 1524 por una orden del Sultán turco otomano Selim I. Del mundo musulmán, la extensión de café a Europa, donde lo llegó a ser popular en el siglo XVII. Los comerciantes holandeses fueron el primer de empezar la importación grande de la escala de café en Europa.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Football (also known as association football or soccer) is a team sport played between two teams, of 11 players each, and is widely considered to be the most popular sport in the world. The modern game was officiated in England following the formation of the Football Association, whose 1863 set of rules created the foundations for how the sport is played today. Football is governed internationally by the FIFA. The most prestigious international football competition is the World Cup, played every four years, which is also the most widely viewed and famous sporting event in the world, even more popular than the Summer Olympics. In many parts of the world football evokes great passions and plays an important role in the life of individual fans, local communities, and even nations.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le football est un sport collectif opposant deux équipes de onze joueurs chacune. Il est largement admis qu'il s'agit du sport le plus populaire au monde. Le jeu moderne a été créé en Angleterre après la formation de la Football Association, dont les règles de 1863 ont servi de base pour définir le sport tel qu'il se joue aujourd'hui. Le football est géré au niveau international par la FIFA. La compétition internationale de football la plus prestigieuse est la Coupe du Monde, organisée tous les quatre ans, qui est aussi l'événement sportif le plus célèbre et le plus regardé au monde. La Coupe du Monde de football est même plus populaire que les jeux olympiques d'été. Dans bien des régions du monde, le football suscite les passions et joue un rôle important dans la vie des fans, des communautés locales et même des nations.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Fußball ist ein Ballsport, bei dem zwei Mannschaften mit je elf Spielern (einem Torhüter und zehn Feldspielern) gegeneinander antreten. Er gilt weithin als die beliebteste Sportart der Welt. Heute gilt England als das Mutterland des Fußballs, denn dort wurde 1863 in London die Football Association (FA) gegründet wurde, welche das umfangreiche Regelwerk aufstellte, das die Grundlage für die heutige Spielweise in diesem Sport bildet. International ist der Fußballsport im Weltverband FIFA organisiert. Das bedeutendste internationale Fußballturnier ist die Fußballweltmeisterschaft, die alle vier Jahre ausgetragen wird. Sie stellt die weltweit berühmteste und meist gesehene Sportveranstaltung überhaupt dar und ist sogar noch populärer als die Olympischen Sommerspiele. In vielen Teilen der Welt weckt der Fußballsport große Leidenschaft und spielt im Leben der einzelnen Fans, regionaler Gemeinschaften und auch Nationen eine bedeutende Rolle.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Il calcio è uno sport di squadra giocato fra due squadre, ognuna composta da 11 giocatori, ed è considerato lo sport più popolare al mondo. Il gioco moderno nacque in Inghilterra in seguito alla formazione della Football Association, le cui regole del 1863 crearono le fondamenta dello sport conosciuto oggi. Il calcio è governato a livello internazionale dalla FIFA. Il torneo internazionale più prestigioso è la Coppa del Mondo: si gioca ogni quattro anni ed è l'evento sportivo più conosciuto e visto a livello mondiale, ancora più popolare delle Olimpiadi. In molte parti del mondo il calcio alimenta grandi passioni e gioca un ruolo importante nella vita dei singoli fan, delle comunità e addirittura delle nazioni.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El fútbol, sin duda el deporte más popular del mundo, se juega entre dos equipos de once jugadores cada uno. El juego moderno fue oficializado en Inglaterra con la fundación de la "Football Association", o "Asociación de Fútbol", cuyo conjunto de 1.863 normas supuso la base del deporte que se juega hoy en día. La FIFA es la organización que rige los destinos del fútbol a nivel internacional. La competición de mayor prestigio es la Copa del Mundo, que se juega cada cuatro años y genera más expectación que ningún otro evento deportivo del mundo, incluyendo los Juegos Olímpicos. En muchas partes del mundo el fútbol suscita grandes pasiones y juega un papel muy importante en las vidas de los aficionados, comunidades locales e incluso naciones.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Made from the leaves or buds of a bush, tea is the liquid created by soaking the extracted foliage in water and it is a popular beverage throughout the world. The "Camellia Sinesis," (tea plant), is grown in tropical and sub-tropical regions of the planet such as China or India. Originally from Southeast Asia, it early on became a staple in the diet of many person from the Orient. It was not until the sixteenth or seventeenth century that it was introduced to Europe as explorers crossed the globe in search of knowledge and treasure. Tea quickly became popular with the wealthy of Western Europe, and Britain would set up numerous plantations in its colony of India to help satiate the demand - India today remains the biggest producer of tea in the world.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Constitué de feuilles ou de bourgeons d'un buisson, le thé est préparé en trempant l'extrait de feuillage dans de l'eau, et c'est une boisson extrêmement populaire à travers le monde. Le "Camellia Sinesis" (la plante) pousse dans les régions tropicales et subtropicales de la planète, et notamment en Chine et en Inde. Originaire d'Asie du Sud-est, le thé devient très tôt un produit de base dans le régime alimentaire de nombreux habitants de l'Orient. Il n'est pas introduit avant le XVIe ou XVIIe siècles en Europe, quand les explorateurs font le tour du monde en quête de nouvelles connaissances et richesses. Le thé devient vite très populaire au sein des classes supérieures de l'Europe de l'ouest et la Grande-Bretagne crée de nombreuses plantations dans ses colonies des Indes pour répondre à la demande. L'Inde reste aujourd'hui le premier producteur mondial.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Als Aufguss aus den Blättern oder Knospen eines Busches zubereitet, ist Tee zu einem weltweit beliebten Getränk geworden. Die "Camellia Sinensis" (Teegewächs) wird in tropischen und subtropischen Regionen wie China oder Indien angebaut. Ursprünglich aus Südostasien stammend, wurde der Tee zu einem wichtigen Bestandteil der orientalischen Ernährungsweise. Erst im 16. oder 17. Jahrhundert brachten Forschungsreisende die Teepflanze schließlich auch nach Europa. Da der Tee als Getränk im reichen Westeuropa großen Anklang fand, legten die Briten in ihrer Kolonie Indien zahlreiche Plantagen an, um die steigende Nachfrage befriedigen zu können, und auch heute noch gehört Indien zu den größten Tee produzierenden Ländern der Welt.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Ricavato dalle foglie o dalle gemme di un arbusto, il tè è una bevanda popolare in tutto il mondo che si ottiene immergendo le foglie nell'acqua calda. la "camellia sinesis" (la pianta del tè) cresce nelle regioni tropicali e sub-tropicali del pianeta (Cina e India, per esempio). Originario del sudest asiatico, ben presto il tè entrò a far parte della dieta di molti orientali, mentre fu introdotto in Europa soltanto nel sedicesimo o diciassettesimo secolo, portato da esploratori che giravano il mondo in lungo e in largo in cerca di nuove conoscenze e tesori. Il tè raccolse in breve tempo il consenso delle classi agiate europee e per soddisfare la domanda, l'Inghilterra creò enormi piantagioni in India, che ancora oggi rimane il più grande produttore di tè al mondo.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El té, líquido creado por la infusión en agua de las hojas o los brotes de un matorral, es una bebida que goza de gran fama en todo el mundo. La "camellia sinesis" (planta del té) crece en regiones tropicales y subtropicales del planeta, como China y la India. Procedente del sudeste de Asia, se convirtió desde muy pronto en la base de la dieta de muchos orientales. Hasta los siglos XVI o XVII no fue introducido en Europa por los aventureros que cruzaban el mundo en busca de conocimientos y tesoros. El té se hizo rápidamente popular entre la gente acomodada de Europa occidental, y los británicos crearían inmensas plantaciones en sus colonias de la India para satisfacer la demanda. En la actualidad, la India continúa siendo el mayor productor mundial.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Buddhism is one of the world's major religions, with more that 350 million followers. Buddhism originated in India and has since spread throughout the subcontinent and into central and southeast Asia.[PARAGRAPH:2]Buddhism follows the teachings of Siddhartha Gautama, the Buddha. Gautama lived from 620 to 540 BC. The Buddha ("enlightened one") sought to teach his followers to search for "Dharma," the truth. By doing so, they too would become enlightened and thus achieve "Nirvana," the perfect peace that would free one's soul from the unending cycle of death and rebirth that all men suffer.[PARAGRAPH:2]Three major schools of Buddhism survive today. Vajrayana believes that people can "speed up" enlightenment through "tantric" techniques such as yoga, mantras (chants), and various other rituals. Theravada and Mahayana are sutric schools that believe that one achieves enlightenment primarily through study of the Budda's teachings.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le bouddhisme, avec plus de 350 millions de fidèles, est considéré comme l'une des principales religions du monde. Originaire d'Inde, il s'est répandu dans tout le sous-continent ainsi qu'en Asie centrale et en Asie du Sud-Est.[PARAGRAPH:2]Le bouddhisme suit les enseignements de Siddhartha Gautama, le Bouddha, qui a vécu de 620 à 540 av. J.-C. Bouddha (l'"Eveillé") s'efforçait d'enseigner à ses adeptes de rechercher le "Dharma", la vérité. De cette manière, ils s'éveilleraient à leur tour et entreraient ainsi dans le "Nirvana," l'état de paix parfaite qui délivrerait leur âme du cycle incessant de la mort et de la renaissance que tous les hommes doivent endurer.[PARAGRAPH:2]Le bouddhisme d'aujourd'hui a vu survivre trois doctrines principales. Selon le bouddhisme vajrayana, les adeptes peuvent "accélérer" leur éveil en recourant à des techniques "tantriques" telles que le yoga, les mantras (chants) et divers autres rituels. Les bouddhismes theravada et mahayana constituent des doctrines sutriques qui considèrent que l'éveil n'est possible qu'après avoir appris les enseignements de Bouddha.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Der Buddhismus ist mit über 350 Millionen Gläubigen eine der Hauptreligionen der Welt. Ausgehend von Indien ist er inzwischen in weiten Teilen Zentral- und Südostasiens verbreitet.[PARAGRAPH:2]Der Buddhismus folgt der Lehre Siddhartha Gautamas (um 560 bis 480 vor Christus). Als Buddha (wörtlich: Erwachter, Erleuchteter) lehrte Gautama seine Anhänger das Dharma (die Lehre) und wurde damit der Begründer des Buddhismus. Ziel des Buddhismus ist das "Nirwana", also ein Zustand, in dem es kein Leid mehr gibt und in dem der Mensch den ewigen Kreislauf von Tod und Wiederverkörperung hinter sich gelassen hat.[PARAGRAPH:2]Heute gibt es drei Hauptrichtungen des Buddhismus. Die Vajrayana-Schule lehrt, dass der Mensch die Erleuchtung durch "tantrische" Techniken, wie Yoga, Mantras (Gesänge) und andere Rituale, "beschleunigen" kann. Theravada und Mahayana sind Sutra-Schulen, die lehren, dass die Erleuchtung allein durch das Studium der Lehren Buddhas erreicht werden kann.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Il Buddismo è una delle religioni più importanti del mondo, con oltre 350 milioni di seguaci. Il Buddismo è originario dell'India e si è poi diffuso in tutto il subcontinente e nell'Asia centrale e sudorientale.[PARAGRAPH:2]Il Buddismo segue gli insegnamenti di Siddhartha Gautaman, il Budda, che visse dal 620 al 540 a. C. Il Budda ("l'illuminato") tentò di insegnare ai suoi seguaci come raggiungere il "Dharma", la ricerca della verità. Solo così è possibile diventare illuminati e raggiungere il "Nirvana", uno stato di pace eterna che libera l'anima degli uomini dal ciclo infinito di morte e rinascita.[PARAGRAPH:2]Al giorno d'oggi, esistono tre grandi scuole di Buddismo: il Vjrayana crede che gli individui possano "velocizzare" l'illuminazione attraverso delle tecniche "tantriche", come lo yoga, i mantra (canti) e altri rituali. Theravada e Mahayana sono differenti scuole che credono nella raggiunta dell'illuminazione attraverso lo studio degli insegnamenti di Budda.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El budismo, con más de trescientos cincuenta millones de seguidores, es una de las religiones más importantes. Se originó en la India, y desde entonces se ha propagado por todo el subcontinente y las regiones centrales y meridionales de Asia.[PARAGRAPH:2]El budismo sigue las enseñanzas de Siddhartha Gautama, el Buda. Gautama vivió entre los años 620 y 540 a. C. El Buda ("iluminado") enseñó a sus seguidores que habían de buscar el "Dharma," la verdad. Al hacerlo alcanzarían la iluminación, y con ella, el "Nirvana", la paz perfecta que liberaría su alma del interminable ciclo de muerte y renacimiento que sufren todos los hombres.[PARAGRAPH:2]En la actualidad existen tres grandes escuelas dentro del budismo. El vajrayana cree que es posible acelerar la iluminación empleando técnicas "tántricas" como el yoga, los mantras (cánticos) y otros rituales. El theravada y el mahayana creen que la iluminación se alcanza fundamentalmente por medio del estudio de las enseñanzas del Buda.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Catholicism is one of the three major divisions (Catholicism, Orthodoxy, and Protestantism) within Christianity. Catholicism and Orthodoxy got officially separated after many years of debates and arguments in the Great Schism in 1054[PARAGRAPH:2]Catholicism is a broad term for the body of the Catholic faith, its theologies and doctrines, its liturgical, ethical, spiritual, and behavioral characteristics, as well as a religious people as a whole.[PARAGRAPH:2]For many the term usually refers to Christians and churches belonging to the Roman Catholic Church in full communion with the Holy See. For others it refers to the churches of the first millennium, including, besides the Roman Catholic Church, the Eastern Orthodox Church, the Oriental Orthodox Church, and the Assyrian Church of the East. And for others again it refers to "adhering to the catholic faith as it has been inherited from the earliest Christians ... seeking to restore the faith and order of the primitive church", as claimed by the Anglican Communion and the Reformation and post-Reformation churches.[PARAGRAPH:2]The Catholic claim of continuity is based on, among other factors, Apostolic succession, especially in conjunction with adherence to the Nicene Creed. In the sense of indicating historical continuity of faith and practice, the term "catholicism" is at times employed to mark a contrast to Protestantism, which tends to look solely to the Bible as interpreted on the principles of the 16th-century Protestant Reformation as its ultimate standard.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le catholicisme est une confession du christianisme représentée par l'Église catholique et ses institutions. Les dogmes et les préceptes du catholicisme se fondent sur l'Ancien et le Nouveau Testament.
