[LINK=TERRAIN_SEMIDESERT]Swamps[\LINK] are another new feature type on Swamps that can be chopped like Forests. [ICON_BULLET][LINK=TERRAIN_WIDE_RIVER]Wide Rivers[\LINK] yield 2[ICON_FOOD] and 2[ICON_COMMERCE], allow ships to navigate, allow naval trade, grant fresh water to adjacent tiles, and allow adjacent tile to act as if they have a River (ex: Levee bonus). [ICON_BULLET]Wide Rivers represent large, navigable rivers, such as the Mississippi, Missouri, Ohio, and Amazon Rivers. You will often have to settle cities in key locations to make Wide Rivers completely navigable. [ICON_BULLET]Many new Resources have been added. [ICON_BULLET]Improvements now cost [ICON_COMMERCE] to construct. You will have to balance infrastructure spending with research, culture, and espionage. [ICON_BULLET]Lots of units of been reworked, and many units have been added. In general, units now have more well-defined roles and upgrade paths. [ICON_BULLET]Certain Seige units, such as Cannon, have been given a ranged attack. Use them to reduce an enemy's strength before attacking. [ICON_BULLET]Most units now have at least 2 Movement. This is to reflect the scale of the new DOCA map. Some units (such as heavy siege units) still only have 1 movement. [ICON_BULLET][LINK=UNIT_MILITIA_1]Militia[\LINK] is now its own upgrade path. Each Era has its own Militia. They are generally cheap to build and weak, with bonus defense in Cities. [ICON_BULLET]New Buildings have been added. [ICON_BULLET]New Wonders have been added. [ICON_BULLET]Each Civilization now has a Regional Power (RP) in addition to a Unique Power (UP). Multiple Civilizations can share a single RP. RPs are unique to certain regions, such as the Andes, Mesoamerica, Europe, Anglosphere, or Latin America. [ICON_BULLET]PLANNED: After a certain date, European Civilizations become more likely to sell their land. [ICON_BULLET]Not every Civilization has access to the same list of Civics. Some Civics only European Civilizations can use, others can only be used by Civilizations native to the Americas, and all the rest are shared between the two.

talleres.[NEWLINE]El [LINK=CIVIC_ENVIRONMENTALISM]Ecologismo[\LINK] da una bonificación al comercio por las [LINK=CONCEPT_BTS_FOREST_PRESERVE]Reservas forestales[\LINK] y los molinos de viento, pero a costa de aumentar el mantenimiento de la corporación en un 25%%.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Cambios en los proyectos[\BOLD][NEWLINE]En la pantalla de victoria verás tu nave espacial y todas las piezas que hayas completado.[NEWLINE]Ahora una nave espacial puede despegar sin todo el revestimiento completo, pero cada pieza que le falte incrementará mucho el riesgo de fallo.[NEWLINE]El [LINK=PROJECT_SS_CASING]Revestimiento para naves espaciales[\LINK] requiere [LINK=TECH_COMPOSITES]Compuestos[\LINK], en lugar de [LINK=TECH_ROCKETRY]Cohetería[\LINK].[NEWLINE]El [LINK=PROJECT_SS_DOCKING_BAY]Muelle de acoplamiento para naves espaciales[\LINK] requiere [LINK=TECH_SATELLITES]Satélites[\LINK] en lugar de [LINK=TECH_ROBOTICS]Robótica[\LINK].[NEWLINE]La [LINK=PROJECT_SDI]SDI[\LINK] requiere [LINK=TECH_LASER]Láser[\LINK].[NEWLINE][LINK=PROJECT_THE_INTERNET]Internet[\LINK] requiere [LINK=TECH_COMPUTERS]Ordenadores[\LINK].[NEWLINE]Los [LINK=PROJECT_SS_THRUSTERS]Propulsores para naves espaciales[\LINK] requieren [LINK=TECH_SUPERCONDUCTORS]Superconductores[\LINK].[NEWLINE]Ya puede retrasarse la llegada de las naves espaciales, y también es posible lanzarlas con sistemas repetidos para aumentar las posibilidades de éxito o acelerar la hora de llegada. También pueden lanzarse sin ciertos sistemas, pero esto incrementará el riesgo de fallo.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Cambios en las mejoras[\BOLD][NEWLINE]Los fuertes han cambiado considerablemente. Visita la sección [LINK=CONCEPT_FORT]Fuertes[\LINK] para una explicación a fondo.[NEWLINE]Los ferrocarriles pueden construirse con petróleo o carbón.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Cambios en la interfaz[\BOLD][NEWLINE]Puedes ver tus misiones en activo en la pantalla del historial [CTRL + TAB].[NEWLINE]El Consejero de Asuntos Exteriores se ha mejorado.[NEWLINE]La pantalla "Los Albores del Hombre" se ha ampliado.[NEWLINE]Los turnos transcurridos, la investigación y los puntos de espionaje por turno se muestran en la pantalla principal.[NEWLINE]Las unidades de la Civilopedia muestran todas las unidades exclusivas que las sustituyen.[NEWLINE]La pantalla de estadísticas muestra ahora la clasificación económica exacta.[NEWLINE]Los enemigos que entren en tu territorio aparecerán marcados con un indicador rojo.[NEWLINE]Hacer clic en tu propia puntuación minimizará la lista de líderes.[NEWLINE]Pulsa [CTRL + H] para seleccionar todas las unidades heridas en una casilla específica.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Cambios en el juego[\BOLD][NEWLINE]Las partidas a velocidad normal ahora tienen 500 turnos, pero el transcurso del tiempo se ha ajustado, por lo que el juego todavía acaba en 2050 d. C.[NEWLINE]Las [LINK=BUILDING_UNITED_NATIONS]Naciones Unidas[\LINK] han crecido enormemente. Visita la sección [LINK=CONCEPT_APOSTOLIC_PALACE]Palacio Apostólico[\LINK] para obtener más detalles.[NEWLINE]Las edades de oro incrementan en un +100%% la tasa de grandes personajes en tus ciudades.[NEWLINE]Solo necesitas un gran personaje en tu primera edad de oro, en lugar de dos.[NEWLINE]No se produce la anarquía al cambiar de principios y de religión durante una edad de oro.[NEWLINE]Para empezar una partida personalizada para un solo jugador o multijugador, puedes seleccionar la opción "Líderes sin restricciones" para jugar con cualquier líder o civilización.[NEWLINE]Seleccionar la opción "Elegir religión" te permite seleccionar qué religión te tocará cuando descubras una tecnología que funde religiones.[NEWLINE]Las rutas comerciales intercontinentales, tanto nacionales como extranjeras, rinden un cien por cien más.[NEWLINE]Debes investigar la Navegación a vela para poder intercambiar en la costa o los ríos fuera de tus fronteras.[NEWLINE]Las religiones ya no confieren visibilidad dentro de una ciudad.[NEWLINE]Los superespecialistas (grandes personajes que se añaden a las ciudades como especialistas) ahora permanecen en la ciudad incluso si ésta es tomada.[NEWLINE]Solo puedes construir cinco maravillas nacionales en un reto de una sola ciudad.[NEWLINE]Puedes intercambiar recursos que ya poseas.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Cambios en los rasgos[\BOLD][NEWLINE]El rasgo Comunicativo solo aumenta el ritmo de producción de los trabajadores en un 25%% (antes era un 50%%).[NEWLINE][LINK=LEADER_AUGUSTUS]César Augusto[\LINK] es un líder Imperialista/Diligente en lugar de Organizado/Creativo.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Cambios en los ascensos[NEWLINE][\BOLD]Las unidades aéreas cuentan ahora con sus propios [LINK=CONCEPT_AIR_PROMOTIONS]ascensos[\LINK].[NEWLINE]Nuevo ascenso, Montaraz III: Cura a las unidades de la misma casilla un 15%% por turno, +50%% al ataque en la selva y en el bosque.[NEWLINE][LINK=PROMOTION_GUERILLA3]Guerrilla III[\LINK] ahora tiene un +50%% de probabilidad de retirarse.[NEWLINE]La [LINK=TECH_MILITARY_SCIENCE]Belicología[\LINK] da acceso a los ascensos "Bombardeo aéreo" y "Comando".[NEWLINE]Las unidades con armas de pólvora pueden acceder al ascenso "Instrucción".[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Cambios en el modo multijugador[NEWLINE][\BOLD]Turnos simultáneos de los equipos: En las partidas multijugador, los jugadores de un mismo equipo pueden llevar a cabo sus turnos simultáneamente.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Cambios en el "modding"[NEWLINE][\BOLD]En la pantalla del creador de mundos puedes colocar fronteras culturales sin la presencia de una ciudad.[NEWLINE]Los mods pueden tener ahora sus propios temas de GFC.[NEWLINE]Se ha añadido un sistema modular XML.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Cambios en los gráficos[\BOLD][NEWLINE]Cada uno de los estilos artísticos (de Oriente Medio, grecorromano, etc.) cuenta con sus unidades de estilo propio. Esto quiere decir que las naves de exploración creadas por Carlomagno y las creadas por Suryavarman II tendrán un aspecto diferente aunque funcionen de igual manera.[NEWLINE]Se han implementado nuevos estilos de carreteras: romanas y modernas.

TEXT.English: [TAB]While most food processing corporations are less than 150 years old, food processing is an ancient tradition. The miller was the original food processing entrepreneur, turning inedible wheat into versatile flour, all while pulling in a tidy profit. Understandably, many modern food processing companies rose from the milling industry, often picking up a few new subsidiaries along the way. Today's food processors deal in a diverse range of consumer products, lining the walls of the local supermarket with everything from mayonnaise to deodorant.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Alors que la plupart des sociétés de l'industrie alimentaire ont moins de 150 ans, la préparation des aliments est une vieille tradition. Le moulin fut la première entreprise de préparation des aliments, transformant le blé non comestible en farine polyvalente tout en suscitant un profit non négligeable. Naturellement, beaucoup de moulins se sont transformés en sociétés agroalimentaires, qui elles-mêmes ont créé de nombreuses filiales. L'industrie alimentaire moderne a une production très variée, inondant les supermarchés avec un grand nombre de produits allant de la mayonnaise au déodorant.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Obwohl es die meisten Lebensmittelhersteller seit weniger als 150 Jahren gibt, ist die Lebensmittelherstellung eine uralte Tradition. Der Müller ist der ursprünglichste Lebensmittelunternehmer, der unverwertbaren Weizen zu vielseitigem Mehl verarbeitet und dabei noch ordentlichen Gewinn macht. Verständlicherweise entwickelten sich aus dem Gewerbe des Müllers zahlreiche Unternehmen der Lebensmittelverarbeitung, die auf dem Weg an die Spitze häufig ein paar neue Tochterfirmen erwarben. Heutzutage handeln Lebensmittelhersteller mit einer großen Palette an Konsumgütern und alle möglichen Produkte zieren die Wände der Supermärkte: von Mayonnaise bis hin zum Deodorant.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Mentre la maggior parte delle società di lavorazione del cibo non ha più di 150 anni, l'attività ha una lunga tradizione. Il mugnaio fu uno dei primi lavoratori di cibo, perché trasformava l'immangiabile grano in versatile farina, realizzando anche un profitto. Chiaramente molte compagnie per la lavorazione del cibo sono nate dall'industria della macinatura, spesso acquistando qualche sussidiaria lungo il cammino. I produttori odierni di cibo hanno a che fare con diversi prodotti per i consumatori e riempiono gli scaffali dei supermercati con tutto, dalla maionese ai deodoranti.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Aunque la mayoría de las grandes empresas dedicadas a ello tienen menos de 150 años, el procesado de alimentos es una tradición muy antigua. El molino, una máquina que transformaba el trigo en harina (y proporcionaba al mismo tiempo un interesante margen de beneficios) fue la primera procesadora de alimentos. Esto explica que muchas de las compañías modernas procedan de la industria de la molienda (que en muchas ocasiones han ido absorbiendo subsidiarias a lo largo de este proceso). Las procesadoras de alimentos de nuestros días trabajan gran variedad de productos y llenan los estantes de los supermercados de todo tipo de bienes, desde mayonesa a desodorante.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Computer Industry, or information technology (IT) industry, is the range of businesses involved in developing computer software, designing computer hardware and computer networking infrastructures, the manufacture of computer components and the provision of information technology (IT) services.

[TAB]The fishing industry includes any industry or activity concerned with taking, culturing, processing, preserving, storing, transporting, marketing or selling fish or fish products. It is defined by the Food and Agriculture Organization as including recreational, subsistence and commercial fishing, and the harvesting, processing, and marketing sectors. The commercial activity is aimed at the delivery of fish and other seafood products for human consumption or as input factors in other industrial processes. Directly or indirectly, the livelihood of over 500 million people in developing countries depends on fisheries and aquaculture.

[TAB]Humanity's fascination with shiny objects has persisted since time immemorial. Gold, silver and jewels have decorated the heads of monarchs and the interiors of palaces for millennia, but it was the nineteenth century that began the true blossoming of the trade in treasures. Gold rushes throughout the world - in the United States, Canada and Australia - not only created new fonts of wealth, but left a lasting impression on the shape of world population, relocating avaricious prospectors to some of the most remote places on earth.[PARAGRAPH:1]The gem trade, with diamonds as its crown, grew up around similar circumstances. Throngs of miners flocked to South Africa in the mid-nineteenth century with the discovery of the "Star of Africa," an enormous 83.5 carat diamond. As of the turn of the twentieth century, the age of the traveling prospector bowed before the growth of enormous precious metal and jewel firms. South Africa remains one of the most important sources for gold and diamonds in the world, as well as the birth place to some of the most influential corporations in the business.
TEXT.French: [TAB]La fascination de l'humanité pour les objets brillants s'exerce depuis des temps immémoriaux. L'or, l'argent et les pierres précieuses ornent les têtes des monarques et l'intérieur des palais depuis des millénaires, mais c'est le dix-neuvième siècle qui inaugure le véritable apogée des échanges d'objets précieux. Les ruées vers l'or qui eurent lieu aux Etats-Unis, au Canada et en Australie créent de nouvelles sources de richesse, mais transforment également la physionomie de la population mondiale, alors que des milliers de cupides prospecteurs partent s'installer dans les lieux les plus reculés de la Terre.[PARAGRAPH:1]Le commerce de pierres précieuses, dominé par celui des diamants, se développe dans des circonstances semblables. Au milieu du dix-neuvième siècle, une foule de mineurs affluent en Afrique du Sud après la découverte du "Cullinan", un énorme diamant de 3 106,75 carats. Puis, au début du vingtième siècle, l'ère du chercheur d'or prend fin et laisse la place à d'énormes firmes spécialisées dans le commerce des pierres et métaux précieux. L'Afrique du Sud demeure l'une des sources d'or et de diamants les plus importantes au monde et a vu naître les sociétés commerciales les plus influentes de ce métier.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Die Faszination für glänzende Gegenstände existiert schon seit Menschengedenken. Gold, Silber und Edelsteine zieren die Köpfe der Könige und das Innere ihrer Paläste schon seit tausenden von Jahren, aber erst im 19. Jahrhundert blühte der Handel mit den edlen Schätzen richtig auf. Goldräusche auf der ganzen Welt - in den USA, Kanada und Australien - haben nicht nur neue Quellen für Reichtum geschaffen, sondern auch die Verteilung der Weltbevölkerung dauerhaft geprägt - habgierige Goldgräber siedelten sich in den abgelegensten Gegenden der Erde an.[PARAGRAPH:1]Der Handel mit Edelsteinen, allen voran Diamanten, entwickelte sich unter ähnlichen Umständen. Mit dem Fund des "Cullinan" - einem riesigen Diamanten von 3106,75 Karat - strömten Bergarbeiter Mitte des 19. Jahrhunderts in Scharen nach Südafrika. Um die Jahrhundertwende endete das Zeitalter der reisenden Goldgräber und machte Platz für das Wachstum riesiger Wertmetall- und Edelsteinunternehmen. Südafrika verfügt weiterhin über die größten Gold- und Diamantenvorkommen der Welt und ist die Geburtsstätte einiger der einflussreichsten Unternehmen der Branche.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]L'umanità è affascinata da tempo immemore dagli oggetti che luccicano. Oro, argento e gioielli hanno decorato le teste di monarchi e gli interni dei palazzi per millenni, ma fu nel diciannovesimo secolo che iniziò a fiorire il commercio di tesori. Le corse all'oro in tutto il mondo (Stati Uniti, Canada e Australia) non solo crearono nuove fonti di ricchezza, ma lasciarono un'impronta duratura sulla distribuzione della popolazione mondiale, con avidi prospettori che si recarono nelle più remote regioni della Terra.[PARAGRAPH:1]Il commercio delle gemme, tra cui spiccano i diamanti, si sviluppò in circostanze simili. Dopo la scoperta del "Cullinan", un gigantesco diamante da 3.106,75 carati, orde di minatori si recarono in Sud Africa a metà del diciannovesimo secolo. All'inizio del ventesimo secolo, l'era del prospettore itinerante si fece da parte davanti alla crescita di enormi compagnie che trattavano metalli preziosi e gemme. Il Sud Africa rimane una delle fonti più importanti al mondo d'oro e di diamanti, così come il luogo in cui nacquero alcune delle più importanti corporazioni del settore.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]La fascinación del hombre por los objetos brillantes existe desde tiempo inmemorial. El oro, la plata y las joyas han engalanado las cabezas de los monarcas y el interior de los templos desde hace milenios, pero fue en el siglo XIX cuando floreció de verdad el comercio de estos tesoros. La fiebre del oro por todo el mundo (en los Estados Unidos, Canadá y Australia), además de crear nuevas fuentes de riqueza, dejó una huella imperecedera en la conformación demográfica del mundo, provocando el traslado de avariciosos prospectores a algunos de los lugares más remotos del planeta.[PARAGRAPH:1]El comercio de piedras preciosas (cuyo monarca era el diamante) creció en circunstancias parecidas. En el siglo XIX, con el descubrimiento del "Cullinan", un enorme diamante de 3106.75 quilates, miles de mineros acudieron en tropel a las tierras de Sudáfrica. Con el cambio de siglo, la era del prospector solitario dejó paso a inmensas compañías extractoras de metales preciosos y producción de joyería. Sudáfrica sigue siendo uno de los principales productores de oro y diamantes del mundo, y sudafricanas son algunas de las empresas más importantes de la industria.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Oil Industry includes the global processes of exploration, extraction, refining, transporting (often by oil tankers and pipelines), and marketing oil products. The largest volume products of the industry are fuel oil and gasoline (petrol). oil is also the raw material for many chemical products, including pharmaceuticals, solvents, fertilizers, pesticides, and plastics. The industry is usually divided into three major components: upstream, midstream and downstream. Midstream operations are usually included in the downstream category.[PARAGRAPH:1]Oil is vital to many industries, and is of importance to the maintenance of industrial civilization in its current configuration, and thus is a critical concern for many nations. Oil accounts for a large percentage of the world's energy consumption, ranging from a low of 32% for Europe and Asia, to a high of 53% for the Middle East.[PARAGRAPH:1]Other geographic regions' consumption patterns are as follows: South and Central America (44%), Africa (41%), and North America (40%). The world consumes 30 billion barrels (4.8 km³) of oil per year, with developed nations being the largest consumers. The United States consumed 25% of the oil produced in 2007. The production, distribution, refining, and retailing of oil taken as a whole represents the world's largest industry in terms of dollar value.[PARAGRAPH:1]Governments such as the United States government provide a heavy public subsidy to oil companies, with major tax breaks at virtually every stage of oil exploration and extraction, including the costs of oil field leases and drilling equipment.

[TAB]The Silk Road or Silk Routes refer to a network of interlinking trade routes across the Afro-Eurasian landmass that connected East, South, and Western Asia with the Mediterranean and European world, as well as parts of North and East Africa. The land routes were supplemented by sea routes which extended from the Red Sea to East Africa, India, China, and Southeast Asia. China traded silk, spices, teas, and porcelain; while India traded ivory, textiles, precious stones, and pepper; and the Roman Empire exported gold, silver, fine glassware, wine, carpets, and jewels.[PARAGRAPH:1]In recent years, both the maritime and overland Silk Routes are again being used, often closely following the ancient routes.[PARAGRAPH:1]Going back nearly 2000 years, during China's Eastern Han Dynasty, a sea route, although not part of the formal Silk Route, led from the mouth of the Red River near modern Hanoi, through the Malacca Straits to Southeast Asia, Sri Lanka and India, and then on to the Persian Gulf and the Red Sea kingdom of Axum and eventually to Roman ports. From ports on the Red Sea, goods, including silks, were transported overland to the Nile and then to Alexandria from where they were shipped to Rome, Constantinople and other Mediterranean ports.[PARAGRAPH:1]Another branch of these sea routes led down the East African coast, called "Azania " by the Greeks and Romans in the 1st century AD, as described in the Periplus of the Erythraean Sea (and, very probably, Zesan in the 3rd century by the Chinese), at least as far as the port known to the Romans as "Rhapta," which was probably located in the delta of the Rufiji River in modern Tanzania.[PARAGRAPH:1]The Silk Road extends from Guangzhou, located in southern China, to present day Brunei, Myanmar (Burma), Thailand, Malacca, Ceylon, India, Pakistan, the Philippines, Iran and Iraq. In Europe it extends from Israel, Lebanon (Collectively, the Levant), Egypt, and Italy (historically, Venice) in the Mediterranean Sea to other European ports or caravan routes such as the great Hanseatic League fairs via the Spanish road and other Alpine routes. This water route is called in some sources "the Indian Ocean Maritime System".

[TAB]For much of human history, victory has gone to those with access to the finest metals. From the Bronze Age onwards, metal tools, weapons and alloys have been an inherent part of the rise of civilization, spurring conquests and construction by the world's greatest empires. And while metal mining has had an impressive history, it was not until the nineteenth century that industrial mining truly began to take root.[PARAGRAPH:1]Two reasons explain this sudden intensification in mining operations. The first was the almost daily revolutions in the production of tools and consumer items, requiring a continual source of metal to produce them. The second was that the fuel that powered the Industrial Revolution was coal, nestled deep within the earth. In modern times, enormous excavators like the Bagger 288 have it possible to mine a pit three-hundred feet long and one-hundred feet deep in a day, a feat that, in the past, would have required the mobilization of nations.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Pendant la majeure partie de l'histoire, la victoire est revenue à ceux qui avaient accès aux métaux les plus précieux. Depuis l'âge du bronze, les outils en métal, les armes et les alliages font partie intégrante de l'essor de la civilisation et poussent les plus grands empires à conquérir de nouveaux territoires et à bâtir de nouveaux édifices. L'extraction du métal existe depuis bien longtemps mais ce n'est qu'au 19ème siècle que l'extraction industrielle a réellement pris son envol.[PARAGRAPH:1]Deux raisons expliquent cette soudaine intensification. Tout d'abord, les innovations quasi-quotidiennes dans la production d'outils et de biens de consommation nécessitent un approvisionnement continu en métal. D'autre part, la révolution industrielle s'est énormément appuyée sur le charbon, lequel était niché au plus profond de la terre. De nos jours, d'énormes pelleteuses comme le Bagger 288 permettent de creuser un trou de quatre-vingt dix mètres de long et trente mètres de profondeur en une journée, exploit qui dans le passé aurait nécessité la mobilisation de nations entières.
TEXT.German: [TAB]In der Geschichte der Menschheit trugen meist diejenigen den Sieg davon, die über die besten Metalle verfügten. Seit dem Bronzezeitalter waren Metallwerkzeuge, Waffen und Legierungen ein grundlegender Faktor für den Aufstieg der Zivilisation und haben Eroberungen und das Bauwesen der weltweit größten Imperien vorangetrieben. Während der Metallabbau schon eine eindrucksvolle Geschichte hinter sich hat, gewann der industrielle Bergbau erst im 19. Jahrhundert an Bedeutung.[PARAGRAPH:1]Für den plötzlichen Aufschwung des Bergbaus gibt es zwei Gründe. Der erste Grund waren die fast alltäglichen Neuerungen in der Produktion von Werkzeugen und Konsumgegenständen, für die der unaufhörliche Nachschub an Metall erforderlich war. Der zweite Grund lag darin, dass der Treibstoff für die industrielle Revolution die Kohle war, die nur tief in der Erde vorkam. Heutzutage ermöglichen es riesige Abbaumaschinen wie der Schaufelradbagger, in nur einem Tag ein 90 Meter langes und 30 Meter tiefes Loch zu graben - eine Meisterleistung, zu der früher nur ganze Nationen mit vereinten Kräften in der Lage gewesen wären.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Per gran parte della storia dell'umanità la vittoria è andata a coloro che avevano accesso ai metalli migliori. Dall'età del Bronzo in poi, strumenti e armi in metallo e lega sono stati parte importante dell'ascesa di una civiltà, favorendo le conquiste e la creazione dei più grandi imperi al mondo. E mentre l'estrazione dei metalli ha una lunga e grande storia, fu solo nel diciannovesimo secolo che cominciò a prendere piede l'estrazione industriale.[PARAGRAPH:1]Due ragioni spiegano l'improvvisa intensificazione delle operazioni minerarie. La prima è la rivoluzione quasi quotidiana nella produzione di strumenti e oggetti di consumo, che richiedeva un costante afflusso di metallo. La seconda è che il carburante della Rivoluzione Industriale era il carbone, annidato nelle profondità della terra. Al giorno d'oggi enormi escavatrici come la Bagger 288 permettono di scavare un buco lungo cento metri e profondo 30 in un solo giorno; un'impresa che, in passato, avrebbe richiesto la mobilitazione di un'intera nazione.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Durante buena parte de la historia del hombre, la victoria ha sido para el bando que tenía acceso a los mejores metales. Desde la Edad de Bronce en adelante, las herramientas, armas y aleaciones de metal han sido una parte inherente del ascenso de las civilizaciones y han permitido grandes conquistas y la construcción de enormes imperios. Y, aunque la minería del metal tiene una historia muy antigua, hasta el siglo XIX no empezó a desarrollarse industrialmente.[PARAGRAPH:1]Dos razones explican esta repentina intensificación de las operaciones mineras. La primera fue una revolución casi diaria en la producción de bienes de consumo y herramientas, que requería un suministro continuo de metal. La segunda fue que el combustible que alimentaba la Revolución Industrial era el carbón, profundamente enterrado en las entrañas de la Tierra. En nuestros días, las grandes excavadoras, como la Bagger 288, poseen la capacidad de excavar fosos de cien metros de longitud y treinta metros de profundidad en un solo día, una proeza que en el pasado habría requerido la movilización de naciones enteras.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Textile Industry or apparel industry is primarily concerned with the production of yarn, and cloth and the subsequent design or manufacture of clothing and their distribution. The raw material may be natural, or synthetic using products of the chemical industry. The textile industry grew out of the industrial revolution in the 18th Century as mass production of yarn and cloth became a mainstream industry.[PARAGRAPH:1]In 1734 in Bury, Lancashire, John Kay invented the flying shuttle - one of the first of a series of inventions associated with the cotton industry. The flying shuttle increased the width of cotton cloth and speed of production of a single weaver at a loom. Resistance by workers to the perceived threat to jobs delayed the widespread introduction of this technology, even though the higher rate of production generated an increased demand for spun cotton.[PARAGRAPH:1]In 1761, the Duke of Bridgewater's canal connected Manchester to the coal fields of Worsley and in 1762, Matthew Boulton opened the Soho Foundry engineering works in Handsworth, Birmingham. His partnership with Scottish engineer James Watt resulted, in 1775, in the commercial production of the more efficient Watt steam engine which used a separate condensor.[PARAGRAPH:1]In 1764, James Hargreaves is credited as inventor of the spinning jenny which multiplied the spun thread production capacity of a single worker - initially eightfold and subsequently much further. Others credit the original invention to Thomas Highs. Industrial unrest and a failure to patent the invention until 1770 forced Hargreaves from Blackburn, but his lack of protection of the idea allowed the concept to be exploited by others. As a result, there were over 20,000 Spinning Jennies in use by the time of his death. Again in 1764, Thorp Mill, the first water-powered cotton mill in the world was constructed at Royton, Lancashire, England. It was used for carding cotton. With the spinning and weaving process now mechanized, cotton mills cropped up all over the North West of England.

[TAB]A trading company is an association formed by investors or shareholders for the purpose of trade, exploration and colonisation. Typically, these companies were formed from the sixteenth century onwards by groups of European investors to underwrite and profit from the exploration of Africa, India, the Caribbean and North America, usually under the patronage of one state, which issued the company's charter. Notable companies include British East India Company and Dutch Verenigde Oostindische Compagnie.

[TAB]The fur trade in the Americas began with the arrival of European explorers and colonizers in the late 15th and early 16th centuries. Europeans quickly realized the potential for profit in the trade of furs, which were highly valued in Europe for their warmth and luxury. The fur trade initially began with the trade of furs from the indigenous people of the Americas, who had been hunting and trading furs for centuries prior to the arrival of Europeans. However, Europeans quickly established their own fur trading networks, which often competed with indigenous traders. In the 17th and 18th centuries, the fur trade became a major economic force in North America, with companies such as the Hudson's Bay Company and the North West Company dominating the trade. These companies established trading posts and forts throughout North America, where they traded furs with indigenous peoples.[PARAGRAPH]The fur trade had a significant impact on the indigenous peoples of the Americas, as they became increasingly dependent on European goods and trade networks. The fur trade also played a role in the colonization and settlement of North America, as fur trading companies often established permanent settlements and trading posts in strategic locations. By the mid-19th century, the fur trade had begun to decline as the demand for furs decreased and alternative materials, such as wool, became more popular. However, the legacy of the fur trade can still be seen in the cultural and economic traditions of many indigenous communities in North America.

However, Europeans quickly established their own fur trading networks, which often competed with indigenous traders. In the 17th and 18th centuries, the fur trade became a major economic force in North America, with companies such as the Hudson's Bay Company and the North West Company dominating the trade. These companies established trading posts and forts throughout North America, where they traded furs with indigenous peoples.[PARAGRAPH]The fur trade had a significant impact on the indigenous peoples of the Americas, as they became increasingly dependent on European goods and trade networks. The fur trade also played a role in the colonization and settlement of North America, as fur trading companies often established permanent settlements and trading posts in strategic locations. By the mid-19th century, the fur trade had begun to decline as the demand for furs decreased and alternative materials, such as wool, became more popular. However, the legacy of the fur trade can still be seen in the cultural and economic traditions of many indigenous communities in North America.
